JobTitle: United States New Iberia: Operator Assistant II - Logging and Perf
JobText: We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry. We bring out the best in wells and people. If you are new to oil field service work and are looking for rewarding possibilities, this Operator Assistant II opportunity may be just what you are looking for. You will be called upon to assist in the operation of well logging equipment while at the job site. This will include the assembly of electric, nuclear, sonic and other well tools, and the performance of pre- and post-job vehicle and equipment inspections. In addition to promoting a safe working environment, you will take an active role in the quality improvement process. The requirements for this job include a high school diploma or equivalent, a commercial driver's license, and 1-year experience in oil field service rig operations; or 3 to 6 months of experience working as a Operator Assistant I. Well Control Accreditation (Well CAP) and water survival training may be required.   Candidates having qualifications that exceed the minimum job requirements will receive consideration for higher level roles given (1) their experience, (2) additional job requirements, and /or (3) business needs.  Depending on education, experience, and skill level, a variety of job opportunities might be available including up to a LP04-ESG-Svc Operator II-L&P .   Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer.   Location 719 Hanger Dr, New Iberia, Louisiana, 70560, United States   Job Details Requisition Number: 39694   Experience Level: Entry-Level  Job Family: Operations  Product Service Line: Wireline and Perforating   Full Time / Part Time: Full Time Additional Locations for this position:    Compensation Information Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.

JobTitle: US Houston: Compliance Audit Investigator (Internal Audit)
JobText: We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.   Halliburton is seeking a Compliance Investigator to actively handle a broad range of Code of Business Conduct (COBC) investigations, including international investigations of alleged violations of U.S. and international laws. The Compliance Investigator will also be responsible for programmatic initiatives including compliance training and global risk assessments.  The position will report to Halliburton’s chief COBC counsel.   Responsibilities: Conduct internal investigations of alleged violations of the Company’s Code of Conduct, as well as U.S. and international laws.  This includes, formulating investigation plans, conducting interviews,  obtaining and analyzing potential documentary and electronic evidence, preparing investigation reports, and presenting investigative results to management. Supervise investigations by other company departments to ensure thoroughness and compliance with company standards. Collaborate with key stakeholders to implement corrective action and improved controls. Track national and international developments in investigation best practices to update or modify the Company’s investigation process. Collaborate with internal and outside counsel to prepare documentation in response to subpoenas, government inquiries, and other internal investigations. Analyze reports made to the Code of Business Conduct to identify statistically significant compliance risk areas and unfavorable trends. Plan, coordinate, and execute global initiatives to assist in managing compliance risks, including assisting in global, regional, or country specific risk assessments. Provide in-person compliance training and outreach to operational partners. 25% travel, sometimes on short notice   Required Qualifications Completion of an undergraduate degree Minimum 3 years of experience in Corporate Compliance Programs   Preferred Qualifications Minimum 5 years of experience conducting investigations in challenging environments such as in-house, law enforcement, or audit/forensic firm Financial audit experience is strongly preferred Possession of a CCEP (Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional certificate) preferred Ability to process and manage large caseloads. Strong analytical skills. Exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to effectively manage and prioritize numerous tasks in a time sensitive environment. Team player, with the ability to fit in well with the Halliburton Law Department Proficient with basic Microsoft Office applications (Word, Outlook) Sufficient fluency to conduct investigations in a second language SAP experience is strongly preferred   Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer.   Location 3000 N. JobTitle: Canada Mount Pearl: Logging Geologist-Surface Data Logging, Senior
JobText: We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry. Under broad direction, independently applies advanced geological interpretation techniques, makes decisions on geological and fundamental engineering problems and methods and represents the organization in conferences to resolve important questions, or to negotiate with key engineers and officials of other organizations. Executes all the duties and responsibilities of an Field Prof-SDL-Geo, II, yet is also responsible for supervising the work of subordinates. Responsible for the success of all phases of assigned well site monitoring jobs, therefore sets performance standards for the crew. Gathers accurate and factual logging information (Depth, Gas Units and Composition, Rate of Penetration, Lag Time, Pressure detection data, etc.). Interprets logging information to determine occurrence and composition of any oil and/or gas shows which occur while drilling. Analyses and documents according to SDL zone of interest and/or show reports. Provides lithological descriptions of all formations drilled and identify formation name, group, or member. Assembles mud logging information into mud logs and drilling database following established SDL and/or customer guidelines and procedures. Communicates mud logging information to customers as necessary to fulfill their requirements (morning report, show notification, engineering problems, delivery of mud logs). Performs any specialized tests or gathers any additional data as required by the customer. Performs safe, neat professional rig-up and tear-down when needed. Ensure smooth transitions at crew changes and shift changes. Completes training appointments as necessary to obtain safety, offshore, or other operations, or customer specific certificates in order to be able to go the designated rig site(s). Skills acquired through the completion of an under graduate degree in Geology and a minimum of 4 years relevant field experience, with an average experience of 5-7 years and completion of on the job development activities to acquire and demonstrate full competence in the job tasks as detailed in the competency system. Ability to demonstrate technical aptitude to standards required. Must possess good communication skills, arithmetic, data entry and recording skills. Ability to perform quality work under moderate to critical conditions with no direct supervision. This role is highly experienced and, due to the very critical nature of wells assigned, customer satisfaction is extremely important. Failure to deliver requisite data will likely be serious and expensive and can lead to bad customer relations varying in degree from slight dissatisfaction to very significant losses of future sales. This is a field position.  Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer.   Location 16 Panther Place, Donovan's In, Mount Pearl, Newfoundlnd/Labrador, A1N 5B1, Canada   Job Details Requisition Number: 37754   Experience Level: Experienced Hire  Job Family: Operations  Product Service Line: Sperry Drilling Svcs   Full Time / Part Time: Full Time Additional Locations for this position:    Compensation Information Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.

Company Name: Roundy's Position Type: Employee FLSA Status: Non-Exempt   Position Summary: Provide back up to the department manager and support all areas of the company’s standard operating position (SOP). Run the department successfully in the manager’s absence, mastering the SOPs, including merchandising, order guides, scheduling, contribution to profit, people development and customer service. Demonstrate the company’s core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety. Essential Job Functions: Demonstrate teamwork to ensure customer satisfaction and a pleasant working and shopping environment. Provide friendly and efficient customer service by demonstrating sincerity, patience and respect in all customer interactions and by thanking customers for their business. Greet customers in a genuine/friendly manner throughout the store; assist them by escorting them to products, loading/unloading heavy items and helping them to retrieve out of reach items. Effectively communicate with customers and respond to questions and requests in a timely manner. Welcome, serve and assist customers; provide back up to the department manager in their absence. Ensure proper staffing to address service levels and efficient utilization of labor. Operate equipment (e.g., slicer, fryer, oven, scale, knives, box cutter, and pricing gun) per company guidelines. Ensure opening/closing procedures are followed according to standard operating procedures (SOPs). Oversee that the backroom is clean and orderly per SOPs. Ensure storage/code dating SOPs are adhered to for all products. Ensure proper cold chain procedure is adhered to at all times; this includes delivery to the store, storage, stocking and holding on the sales floor. Assure all receiving procedures are adhered to appropriately. Follow all merchandising guidelines, including display models, signage and product packaging. Verify all Deli associates are properly trained to use the scales to assure correct pricing. Confirm removal and disposal of un-sellable product from sales floor. Monitor temperature of coolers/freezers to maintain freshness of products. Perform stocking duties, ensuring correct placement of stock and refilling of product. Comply with and reinforce all food safety, sanitation and safety regulations/guidelines/procedures and programs according to company, local, state, and federal health code regulations; identify unsafe conditions and notify store management. Maintain ability to work varied shifts and relocate to another store location. Physical demands include, but are not limited to, frequently walking, standing, turning, kneeling, reaching, squatting, and stooping/bending, lifting/carrying objects 5 to 80 lbs., pushing/pulling objects 200 to 2,000 lbs., regular exposure to cold temperatures and wet surfaces Occasionally crawl, climb ladders and walk on uneven ground. Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation. Coordinate customer service, ordering, designing, merchandising, department maintenance, inventory control and product care. Demonstrate the company’s core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety. Plan, delegate and write associate work assignments/labor schedules. Create and implement attractive/creative displays and signage; integrate new/seasonal items. Order floral supplies based on availability, costs, gross profit and sales projections. Complete department paperwork, review reports and take inventory. Partner to coordinate in-store promotions and advertising; update pricing in the Point of Sale system. Strip, cut and condition flowers/plants properly and place for sale; ensure proper pricing and maintain the floral scan file accurately. Care for product on the sales floor and in the cooler; properly water all plants including hanging baskets, check fresh flower water levels, remove dead leaves and ensure balloons are properly inflated. Operate deli equipment (e.g., slicer, fryer, oven, scale, knives, box cutter and pricing gun) according to company guidelines. Provide work direction, effective training, development and corrective action for Deli associates and direct them to achieve department and company objectives; conduct performance reviews. Ensure proper staffing to address service levels and efficient utilization of labor. Schedule properly trained associates to open/close the department per Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Organize backroom and coolers to receive daily deliveries and ensure proper temperature of coolers. Ensure storage and code dating SOPs are followed for all products. Write orders based on individual store needs and trends; be alert to communications from the Deli Merchandising team. Manage the process for price changes and in-store transfers. Ensure removal and disposal of un-sellable product from the sales floor. Ensure proper cold chain procedures are adhered to including delivery to the store, storage, stocking and holding on the sales floor. Follow all merchandising guidelines, including display models, signage and product packaging. Comply with and reinforce all food safety, sanitation and safety regulations/guidelines/procedures and programs according to company, local, state, and federal health code regulations; identify unsafe conditions and notify store management. Physical demands include, but are not limited to, frequently walking, standing, turning, kneeling, reaching, squatting, stooping/bending, lifting/carrying objects 5 to 80 lbs., pushing/pulling objects 200 to 2,000 lbs., regular exposure to cold temperatures and wet surfaces Occasionally crawl, climb ladders and walk on uneven ground. Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation. Company Name: Kroger Stores Position Type: Employee FLSA Status: Non-Exempt     eCommerce in our world means: If you’re tired of sitting at a desk or standing behind a register and want to be active at your job, than you’ve come to the right place. We are a Fortune 17 company with the feel of your corner grocery store. In our entry level eCommerce roles you won’t have any trouble getting your steps in while you’re retrieving products from all corners of the store. Call it a grocery scavenger hunt on steroids. So apply today and begin your career adventure with us tomorrow! We need your skills: Pick it - Pack it - Place it… Prepare and deliver online orders that exceed customer expectations for ease of shopping, variety and, above all, freshness. The devil is in the details… Scan and bag products to fulfill customers’ online orders while paying particular attention to specific customer instructions. Crisp Execution - Tick-Tock we’re on the clock… Ensure quality and freshness (key company initiatives) of all items while meeting and exceeding timeliness and efficiency standards. Remember, it’s a busy world and time is money. Maintain and process orders through state-of-the-art systems and deliver our high-quality products into customers’ cars quickly and efficiently. Action - Exercise - Amusement… Enjoy working in our fun team atmosphere, compete with co-workers (meet deadlines), challenge yourself (standing for extended periods of time) and get some exercise (walking extensively, as well as stooping, kneeling or crouching several times an hour) all while providing a SMILE to our many repeat customers. Your customer service keeps them coming back for more. J “Houston we have a problem”… Notify customers of any product substitutions at time of pick up. There is no “I” in TEAM… Assist in training new e-Commerce team members (we are always looking for great associates, so pass the word). Provide input on best practices to meet operational needs and develop schedules. Cradle to grave…. Perform required opening and closing procedures. Troubleshoot and maintain e-Commerce equipment and ensure staging areas are organized and cleanly. What we need from you to keep families coming back to our stores: Can’t do without… Ability to SMILE…you are the face of our company. A necessity… Ability to talk, not just text…excellent communication skills are required. Ability to operate a smart phone…Ctrl-Alt-Delete and other basic PC skills will get you going. 2 + 2 =? - Basic math is needed…no calculus required here. We provide the rest… Training & advancement (we’ll help you get ahead) Discounts and other perks (you get more than a check) Training, coaching, mentoring (we see your potential) Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K (...and so much more!) Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to travel independently. Minimum 21 years of age. JobTitle: Guest Experience Manager, M&M's World New York City
JobText: A mutually rewarding experience. Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet.  What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability. Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job. Mars has net sales of more than $33 billion, operates six business segments including Petcare, Chocolate, Wrigley, Food, Drinks, Symbioscience, and more than 75,000 Associates worldwide that are putting its Principles into action to make a difference for people and the planet through its performance. Mars brands include: Petcare – PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, BANFIELD® Pet Hospital, CESAR®, SHEBA®, DREAMIES® and NUTRO®; Chocolate – M&M’S®, SNICKERS®, DOVE®, GALAXY®, MARS®, MILKY WAY® and TWIX®; Wrigley – DOUBLEMINT®, EXTRA®, ORBIT® and 5™ chewing gums, SKITTLES® and STARBURST® candies, and ALTOIDS® AND LIFESAVERS® mints. Food – UNCLE BEN’S®, DOLMIO®, EBLY®, MASTERFOODS®, SEEDS OF CHANGE® and ROYCO®; Drinks – ALTERRA COFFEE ROASTERS™, THE BRIGHT TEA COMPANY™, KLIX® and FLAVIA®; Symbioscience – COCOAVIA® and WISDOM PANEL®. Purpose of Role: The Guest Experience Manager is responsible for delivering an exceptional Guest experience from the first impression /greeting, to the Box Office. This role is primarily responsible to drive sales through a trained and engaged team of Onstage associates and through the accountability and follow up of the category champion program   Principal Accountabilities:    DRIVE RESULTS / GUEST SERVICE- ACHIEVE OUR GOALS BY BRINGING MORE CHOCOLATE SMILES TO OUR GUESTS   Trains and develops Onstage sales, box office and merchandisers to ensure store meets and / or exceeds quantifiable performance metric’s (e.g. Net Sales, Conversion, Average Dollar Sale, etc.) Assesses, evaluates and coaches Onstage associates utilizing the Mars selling strategy to drive sales Role models the behaviors of an effective Manager on Duty to ensure achievement of all sales objectives and goals Adheres to “leadership” Onstage at all times  Manages Guest flow and wait times at the box office Open and close secondary registers as needed to optimize register productivity Encourages up-sell at register and facilitate grab-and-go sales by utilizing primary registers on floor Achieves positive results on mystery shop evaluations Displays a "Guest comes first" attitude by training and holding associates accountable for delivering legendary service Demonstrates understanding of retail metrics; celebrate success and make suggestions for improvement when necessary Exudes a positive attitude and sustains a contagious energy throughout entire shift   TALENT MANAGEMENT- DELIVER AN EXPECTIONAL RETAIL EXPERIENCE BY DELIGHTING OUR GUESTS THROUGH OUR FUN, KNOWLEDGE AND PASSION FOR OUR BRAND   Provides consistent, fair and timely feedback to associates through various channels, i.e. one on one opportunities, reviews, coaching, mentoring, training Trains and educates associates on new product knowledge, selling strategies and new merchandise presentation techniques Coaches associates in the moment to reward outstanding results / behaviors and to correct and improve developmental opportunities Manages the content and delivery of pre-shift meetings; rotate meetings to be both educational and entertaining Manages a group of assigned associates including Onstage: Sales, Box Office, Merchandisers and Supervisors ensuring clear expectations are communicated, results are followed up and accountability is applied Ensures all associates are upbeat, engaging and fun, if not take action   PRESENTATION EXCELLENCE- CREATE A VISUALLY EXCITING MERCHANDISE PRESENTATION BY DELIVERING OUR BRAND STANDARD PROMISE   Demonstrates knowledge of products, placement Onstage, sales impact according to the space occupied and general understanding of category components In partnership with Store Director and corporate team ensures proper and effective training and development is provided to associates to achieve an exceptionally visually appealing store that is Big, Bold and clearly branded   OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE- ENSURING OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCIES WHILE DELIVERING AN EXCITING RETAIL EXPERIENCE    Ensures all areas of the store including Onstage and Backstage are neat clean, organized, operational and safe Complies with and ensures that all associates follow company policies and procedures In partnership with Store Director ensure that store is in compliance with all employment State and Federal laws, including but not limited to wage and hour and Equal Employment Opportunity Ensures that the store protects company assets thorough awareness of Loss Prevention best practices, including great guest service, associate bag checks, associate purchases, as  well as all other compliance to company policies and procedures   PERSONAL LEADERSHIP- EXEMPLIFY LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES THAT DRIVE A HIGH PERFORMING, HIGHLY ENGAGED TEAM   Be an inspiration to others, ethically and professionally Demonstrates confidence and focus during periods of high volume or unexpected events to keep store operating to standard and to set a positive example for the store team Share information and communicate clearly to all levels Lead by managing through change and adversity Exemplifies the Five Principles of Mars Promotes store involvement in Mars community service, wellness and sustainability programs Cultivates a collaborative learning environment within the store by modeling purpose, values and behaviors consistent with Mars philosophy Helps to drive consensus while managing a diverse management team and/or collaborating with colleagues in other stores/departments Provides an open door policy where associates are free to express their ideas, concerns and feelings and an environment where the 5 principles of Mars are modeled and upheld Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

JobTitle: Entry Level Food Prep Operator (Rotating Shift)
JobText: A mutually rewarding experience. Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet.  What you get here is challenging, interesting work. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability. Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job. Mars has net sales of more than $33 billion, operates six business segments including Petcare, Chocolate, Wrigley, Food, Drinks, Symbioscience, and more than 75,000 Associates worldwide that are putting its Principles into action to make a difference for people and the planet through its performance. Mars brands include: Petcare – PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, BANFIELD® Pet Hospital, CESAR®, SHEBA®, DREAMIES® and NUTRO®; Chocolate – M&M’S®, SNICKERS®, DOVE®, GALAXY®, MARS®, MILKY WAY® and TWIX®; Wrigley – DOUBLEMINT®, EXTRA®, ORBIT® and 5™ chewing gums, SKITTLES® and STARBURST® candies, and ALTOIDS® AND LIFESAVERS® mints. Food – UNCLE BEN’S®, DOLMIO®, EBLY®, MASTERFOODS®, SEEDS OF CHANGE® and ROYCO®; Drinks – ALTERRA COFFEE ROASTERS™, THE BRIGHT TEA COMPANY™, KLIX® and FLAVIA®; Symbioscience – COCOAVIA® and WISDOM PANEL®. Position Description: Perform and report Food Prep operational activity in order to comply with safety, quality, and productivity targets.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: * Operate Food Prep systems in accordance with Royal Canin Operating Procedures in a safe, productive, and efficient manner at all times. * Perform Food Prep operational activity according to production and planning schedules and requirements. * Perform required Quality Control checks and analysis on each delivery of materials to be received in accordance to Royal Canin Quality Procedures. * Perform periodic and routine inventories of raw materials in storage. * Prepare delivery equipment for receiving of materials. * Receive and unload raw materials and supplies from delivery equipment. * Provide and perform material receiving and storage data entry and reporting as required. * Provide and perform routine maintenance checks on equipment. * Provide reporting and documentation of Quality, Production, Maintenance, and Sanitation activities in accordance with Royal canin Operating Procedures. * Assist in other production, sanitation, maintenance, and quality activity in other areas as directed. * Provide functional communications with other staff members as necessary to optimize quality, efficiency, productivity and safety. * Perform all duties in compliance with Royal Canin Quality Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practices. * Adhere to all Royal Canin safety requirements. * Perform housekeeping and sanitation procedures in accordance with Royal Canin's Food Safety and sanitation Program. * Other duties assigned to you. * Standing on concrete floor * Wearing proper personal protective equipment. * Bending, stooping, twisting, standing for extended periods of time periods, reaching, climbing stairs and lifting up to 55 pounds. * Must be able to adapt to temperature and environment extremes such as hot and cold, dust, dirt and chemicals. * Vision correctable to 20/20.   EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATION:   * High School graduate or equivalent. * 18 years of age or older. * Demonstrated competency in computer and PC software including MS Office and email. * Willing to work rotating shifts. * Manufacturing experience.   KEY FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES AND TECHNICAL SKILLS:   * High level of mechanical aptitude and knowledge with good skills in troubleshooting and problem solving. * Forklift capability * Manufacturing experience Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Founded by a veterinarian in 1968, Royal Canin has more than 40 years of experience in delivering individualized nutritional solutions. In collaboration with an expert team of nutritionists, breeders and veterinarians from around the world, Royal Canin places cats and dogs at the central point of the innovation process. The Royal Canin product line offers a range of diets based on size, age, breed, lifestyle and therapeutic requirements. Royal Canin diets are available at veterinary hospitals and pet specialty stores nationwide. Royal Canin is a subsidiary of Mars, Incorporated. To learn more about Royal Canin, visit www.royalcanin.us     Job Purpose: Perform and report Extrusion operational activity in order to comply with safety, quality, and productivity targets Key Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job. Mars has net sales of more than $33 billion, operates six business segments including Petcare, Chocolate, Wrigley, Food, Drinks, Symbioscience, and more than 75,000 Associates worldwide that are putting its Principles into action to make a difference for people and the planet through its performance. Mars brands include: Petcare – PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, BANFIELD® Pet Hospital, CESAR®, SHEBA®, DREAMIES® and NUTRO®; Chocolate – M&M’S®, SNICKERS®, DOVE®, GALAXY®, MARS®, MILKY WAY® and TWIX®; Wrigley – DOUBLEMINT®, EXTRA®, ORBIT® and 5™ chewing gums, SKITTLES® and STARBURST® candies, and ALTOIDS® AND LIFESAVERS® mints. Food – UNCLE BEN’S®, DOLMIO®, EBLY®, MASTERFOODS®, SEEDS OF CHANGE® and ROYCO®; Drinks – ALTERRA COFFEE ROASTERS™, THE BRIGHT TEA COMPANY™, KLIX® and FLAVIA®; Symbioscience – COCOAVIA® and WISDOM PANEL®.   Purpose/Overview   This position is responsible for developing and commercializing packaging initiatives that support core brand growth, efficiency and innovation for Mars Petcare North America.  This role provides technical support to troubleshoot key quality or manufacturing issues. Key Responsibilities 1. Develops detailed packaging specifications to ensure quality materials and best value for money on all packaging components used at our facilities, co-packers and co-manufacturers. 2. Initiates, coordinates and executes line trials at appropriate supply locations to confirm that quality attributes and performance metrics are achieved. 3. Under guidance from Senior and Principle Packaging Engineers, supports development of ‘fit for purpose ‘packaging in collaboration with Cross-Functional teams;   meets cost targets, is sensitive to environmental needs, processes through the factory, protects the product through the entire distribution channel, and provides functionality to the retail customer and consumer. 4. Uses existing procedures to implement new packaging materials and systems for application to company products. 5. Exchanges information with packaging suppliers to ensure proper execution of projects. 6. Coordinates the creation of high quality prototypes to gauge consumer desirability, influence teams and support customer collaboration. 7. Shares project level information to global Mars counterparts as requested. 8. Understands Intellectual Property (patents) landscape of portfolio of technologies in area of responsibility. Scope   Delivers on key responsibilities by: • Learning and utilizing defined foundational processes for packaging development and testing • Developing and leveraging internal and external networks • Managing deliverables of multiple projects simultaneously • Consulting on packaging solutions with guidance from Senior and Principle Engineers • Effectively communicating projects details and risk in appropriate forum to all levels of organization • Being a passionate, engaged and active member of team and function • Understanding impact on other functional areas to develop business acumen and enterprise thinking • Exhibiting high levels of intellectual curiosity and entrepreneurial behavior Qualifications Education • BS degree in Packaging Science (preferred) or other engineering/science related discipline Knowledge/Experience • Related packaging internship or 1+ years packaging development background • Food/CPG packaging materials and/or equipment experience preferred   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Purpose of Role The Senior Strategic Sourcing Manager is responsible for maximizing value for money in goods and services buying and performance management. The role has responsibility for all MSS buying categories, supplier relationships, and for delivering a competitive advantage from leveraging those relationships. Specific buying categories managed include (but are not limited to): R&D Support Services Research Agreements P&O Support Services Marketing and Sales Support Services Operations Support Services Contract Manufacturing Agreements Order Fulfilment Services Warehousing and Logistics Service Agreements Facility Maintenance Service Agreements Utilities Job responsibilities include soliciting and analyzing competitive bids, managing liability and legal risks to the business, and developing and executing all third-party contracts. The role ensures a fair and disciplined approach to supplier feedback to drive continuous improvement in performance; leveraging compensation models. The role ensures maintenance of a competitive advantage by executing benchmarking and prominently participating in industry and trade forums to understand, influence, and lead new thought trends, innovations, and overall market knowledge of the buying categories. The role is responsible for sourcing and category strategies and continuously identifies supply development opportunities and other divisional objectives as presented. This role collaborates with other regional managers and contributes to global buying work streams as they relate to the United States market, developing strategies and tactics to improve value and supplier business relationships. Principle Accountabilities Develop buying and performance strategies with client functions to ensure services delivered at costs below market and competition while maintaining sufficient creative flexibility to meet business requirements. Is directly responsible for negotiating all third-party contracts for the identified buying categories, including evaluating current market conditions, trends, and their effect on timing and costs for purchasing goods and services. Conduct price and service level negotiations, including analyzing the services and supplier industry, including competitive information, to ensure best "value for money" results. Conducting industry benchmarking to ensuring a competitive on-going advantage. Ensure on-going value for money delivered by supplier partners on an annual basis (e.g., but using lean pipeline analysis techniques). Develop and implement procedures and policies for the purchasing of services to obtain cost efficiencies, minimize risk to the corporation, and ensure proper lead times for effective delivery. Develop and maintain proper business discipline, relationships, and formal and informal performance feedback mechanisms between Mars Associates and suppliers, ensuring that quality and service are not sacrificed for price. Ensure regional execution of Global Commercial Strategies, if applicable. Develop the strength and capability of the Commercial team to meet buyers’ personal development goals and deliver business objectives. Decision Making Authority and Impact Commitment of MSS’ funds Buying and negotiating strategies Supplier selection, investigation, and approval Supplier performance assessments Contract development and execution Supplier arbitration / conflict management Risk mediation External industry and supplier relationships Make Recommendations Regarding the following Sourcing alternatives Effectiveness initiatives Management and motivational techniques for strategic suppliers and recruiters Market / industry analyses Cost / quality improvements Risk management Key Functional Skills/Knowledge Principles of contracting and commercial law Solid interpersonal, conflict management, and influencing skills Project management skills Analytical skills Negotiating skills Written and verbal communication skills Commercial negotiation Commercial finance Legal contracting Sourcing strategy development Intellectual property management Mission Critical Competencies Conflict Management Dealing with Ambiguity Decision Quality Peer Relationships Problem Solving Process Management Educational and Professional Qualifications Bachelor’s degree Professional qualifications desired At least 5 (five) years of Commercial experience desired Travel Approximately 10% (domestic and international) People Management Responsibilities Directly manage two Commercial Buyers Indirectly manage third-party suppliers Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Job Purpose/Overview: The Retail Visual Merchandiser will be responsible for the creation and execution of the M&M’S Retail visual merchandising standards for each of our M&M’s retail channels.  This role will ensure that the corporate visual standards are maintained through brand execution, operational excellence, and collaboration with merchandise, creative, and retail partners. This role will be responsible for bringing the merchandise vision to life in each retail channel and they will develop the floor layouts, fixture plans, and activity based merchandising strategies across all retail channels and product groups with the objective of driving top line sales/profits through compelling Brand and Merchandise presentations.  The visual merchandiser will create and implement visual merchandising presentations that support and evolve the M&M’s Merchandise and Creative vision.  The role will work with the store teams to drive the overall merchandising vision and provide the in-store merchandisers with the tools and direction needed for seamless execution of our merchandising strategy.  The role will also support in store capital projects to ensure consistency in design and floor/space planning from an merchandising standpoint.   Key Responsibilities • Create and execute the visual merchandising strategy and standards for all M&M’s Retail channels. • Partner, coach, and develop store teams to understand corporate visual merchandising standards. • Organize and conduct visual merchandising training sessions for retail. • Serve as a strong visual team partner with positive, solution based approach to Visual department needs. • Create visual merchandising direction for all product categories/departments for each store that are in line with the overall Brand directive and enhance our consumer experience. Create visual merchandising presentations that are compelling, engaging, and executable.  • Plan, create, and ensure accuracy of Visual communications content for stores, including monthly stage sets, updates, tiered and layered product assortments for all product categories. • Implement in-store installations and online product activations according to corporate standards and timlines. • Develop space plans and plan-o-grams for all merchandise and product categories ensuring the productivity and maximizing sales potential. • Evaluate and analyze the success of the merchandising plan with regard to sales, implementing changes as needed for all stores. • Develop and implement floor set turnover process for all stores. Plan and coordinate floor set turnover process to stores/store operations. • Actively collaborate with store management team to make the best visual decisions for that store while maintaining the corporate visual standards. • Demonstrate awareness of current M&M’s Brand advertising and marketing campaigns, new product launches, and update store visuals accordingly. • Communicate visual activity calendar and priorities to the store and online teams. • Serve as the global Visual representative for M&M’s Retail at all times. Work in collaboration with merchandising and creative partners regarding interpretation of all seasonal visual concepts. • Leads the creation of in store visual elements with the store teams: signage, graphics, fixtures, and merchandise to bring the company programs to life on the selling floor. • Create/Select all graphic and asset requests for the retail channels. • Collaborate with retail graphic design team to develop creative visual needs for each retail channel. • Work with merchandising team to gain complete understanding of all product and product initiatives, and ensure full understanding and awareness of all current product and product information to the retail associates. • Assume all responsibility for communication to store regarding merchandising strategy, plans, and vision. • Actively seek creative visual excellence through competitive research, industry expertise, and unconventional sources of creative inspiration. • Utilize applicable reporting and tools to manage inventory levels and evaluate merchandising decisions.   Education & Professional Qualification • Required: High school diploma/GED or equivalent • Required:  Degree in visual merchandising, fashion merchandising, marketing, or related field or equivalent business experience.   Experience • Minimum 4+ years visual merchandising experience • Comprehensive understanding of merchandising initiatives and P.O.P. development process. • Strong demonstrated visual merchandising/presentation skills. • Knowledgeable of current fashion and visual merchandising trends and able to effectively interpret/apply to our Brand. • Ability to read and analyze retail reports and take action as necessary to adjust merchandising and presentations set ups. • Innovative thinker/Problem solver • Strong communication, organizational and time management skills • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English) • Project management skills & Strong delegation skills • Demonstrated complex planning & organizational skills • Advanced computer skills required, including Microsoft Office and Adobe (illustrator, InDesign, and photoshop). • Experience working in a high paced retail environment highly recommended • Proven self-starter with a record of staying on track and pursuing solutions without supervision   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

The purpose of the Logistics Analyst role is to understand, predict, improve / and or control logistics operations and processes.  This person will be responsible for data management, analyzing performance, identifying problems, and developing recommendations that support logistics management.   Solves problems by considering courses of action within the framework of business goals.   Key Responsibilities •            Manage and drive Royal Canin USA DiB savings targets of 4% of current >$80 Million budget. •            Develop and maintain analysis and reporting which supports various Supply Chain Distribution functions.  •            Perform analysis in support of business enhancements which will result in cost savings •            Analyze logistics data, using a variety of tools to understand, predict, improve and control logistics operations. •            Confer with logistics management teams to determine ways to optimize service levels, maintain supply-chain efficiency, or minimize cost. •            Review procedures, such as distribution or inventory management, to ensure maximum efficiency or minimum cost. •            Period reporting providing logistics cost insights by business segment and transportation type •            Coordinate with Logistics Services Manager and Finance to provide insights into expected future costs based on contract changes, business activities, etc. •            Lead the analysis and provide statistical information on the tracking of product shipments, returns, and inventory. •            Evaluate existing capabilities and establish new systems and processes for the tracking, measurement, reporting, and analysis of all traffic. •            Model distribution network •            Lead process improvement project supporting supply chain key metrics •            Write or revise standard operating procedures for logistics processes •            Develop and execute scorecard for key organizational metrics •            Other special projects as assigned.   Context and Scope Relevant Quantitative and Budget Information Financial             Staff      none Other      Job Specifications/Qualifications 1. Education & Professional Qualification Bachelor's degree required in Business, or Supply Chain related preferred Six Sigma / Lean Certification – Preferred   2. Knowledge/Experience Broad knowledge of Logistics, Distribution, and Transportation processes Strong analytical and problem solving skills Skilled in the lean process methodology that is used to support more efficient ways of working   Level of role, Critical MLCs and Competencies    Individual Contributor • Delivers Consistent Results • Creates Collaborative Relationships                              People Leader • Develops Talent • Engages Associates                              Senior Leader • Practices Breakthrough Thinking • Navigates Complex Challenges   Key Supporting Competencies Drive for Results – Can be counted on the exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented. These roles create competitive advantage through technical innovation, project management, and business partnership. Leveraging continuous improvement methodologies, engineering principles, and driving manufacturing technology excellence, our Engineers have rich and rewarding careers by having depth of experience in, or breadth of experience across Process, Packaging, Electrical & Controls, and Facilities/Environmental Engineering, as well as Engineering and Maintenance Leadership. Our unique dual career ladder facilitates career progression equally for technical expertise leadership roles and for technical managerial roles.   The Regional Project Engineer is a primary technical resource for technical project management in the area of Processing, Packaging, Facilities, Utilities, Safety, and the Environment for projects between $1M - $20M. The Regional Project Engineer responsibilities include managing and coordinating all project activities and corporate / factory relationships as well as managing project performance within safety, quality, budgetary, and schedule guidelines. Their overall role is to identify and lead projects in the manufacturing environment and across the Americas Region. Projects may include new manufacturing line construction projects in existing factories, multi-factory projects involving significant changes in process & packaging equipment, as well as building and utility construction and installation. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Overall: • Lead regional cross functional teams, technical and non-technical, to deliver large initiative projects to achieve business objectives • Lead regional large project initiatives at any Mars-Wrigley or external manufacturing partner site in the Americas region • Develop and maintain partnerships with Finance, Regional IEs, Global technical groups, External Manufacturing, Innovation, R&D and other regional functions in order to deliver regional project initiatives from inception to delivering all KPIs and objectives Project Management: • Americas Region large initiative project engineer ($1M - $20M) • Leverage strong Project Management, TPM Methodologies, and Team Leadership strategies to organize and execute projects • Develop and maintain partnerships with assigned project manufacturing representatives to execute projects from initial scoping and funding, through detailed engineering and procurement, to startup and commissioning, and then final documentation and closure • Develop and validate project scope of work: this includes technology review(s), gap analysis between existing and desired conditions, infrastructure and environmental assessments • Ensure compliance with all environmental, safety, and health requirements, and promote a safe working environment for project execution • Monitor and support construction activities to ensure that projects are completed according to the design deliverables, quality standards, and plant requirements, and that pre-startup safety reviews are conducted • Follow through to ensure that Operations achieves a successful vertical startup, and that any project-related action items are completed • As required, maintain SAP project data entries, monitor project progress through scheduling and other tools, perform project status reporting, and control spending through appropriate tracking, forecasting, and adjustments • As required, perform procurement support activities, including preparing specifications, issuing requisitions, evaluating bids, and dealing with vendors.  Work with Procurement and comply with applicable guidelines • Participation and / or leadership of a core technology Center of Excellence (COE) across the region Discipline Engineering: • Initiate, design, plan and lead technical investigations into complex technical opportunities requiring innovative solutions • Plan, direct, execute, review and report on all design activities involved in projects.  Interpret results and translate into actionable recommendations / business solutions for on-time, in-budget execution. (Includes all project stages from concept development, process design and commercialization / scale-up) • Develop PFDs, P&IDs, equipment specifications, etc. • Ensure process design conforms to company and industry safety standards. Implement safe designs and fully leverage Wrigley’s Safe Start Process • Adhere to current corporate and plant requirements for equipment/materials specifications and vendor preferences DECISION MAKING AUTHORITY, RECOMMENDATIONS AND IMPACT • Selection of equipment / technology to meet business strategy (Process, Packaging, Electrical & Controls, Project, and Facilities/Environmental Engineering) • Innovation within current standards framework and leadership to challenge and gain consensus on continuous improvement for existing standards • Member of regional engineering team and will have input on project execution and technology implementations across the region • Accountabilities across the region for project management and / or project discipline lead management for projects at multiple sites QUALIFICATIONS Education/Training: Minimum: • BS in Engineering from ABET-accredited program, Packaging or Food Science, or related field / equivalent experience Preferred: • Advanced degree in Engineering or MBA • TPM and engineering experience in food or consumer packaged goods (CPG) Related Experience / Requirements Minimum: • Minimum 6 years of related experience in a comparable technical position in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, or CPG related industry. Preferred: • 10+ years of related experience in a comparable technical position in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, or CPG related industry. Knowledge / Skills / Abilities Minimum: • In-depth understanding of engineering principles and knowledge of engineering disciplines:  Process, Packaging, Electrical & Controls Facilities, or Utilities, etc. • Proven project management and practical factory experience in a specific (or multiple) engineering disciplines • Possess knowledge in discipline engineering / execution (design, installation, and start-up of projects in a specific (or multiple) engineering disciplines • Ability to work on several projects at a time and effectively prioritize workload and meet deadlines • Demonstrated leadership in projects with internal and external stakeholders • Experience working with High Performance Teams • Demonstrated experience in technical training to factory and technical associates • Strong computer skills (excel, word, Microsoft Project, SAP, etc.) • Travel as needed across the North America Region up to 60% travel required Preferred: • Leadership and strategy development and implementation skills • Continuous improvement experiences (Lean, TPM, Kaizen, Six Sigma) • Demonstrated experience in leading and managing multi-million dollar capital investments • Demonstrated track record of strategic thinking, managerial courage, innovation management, interpersonal savvy, project planning, and dealing with uncertainty   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job. Mars has net sales of more than $33 billion, operates six business segments including Petcare, Chocolate, Wrigley, Food, Drinks, Symbioscience, and more than 75,000 Associates worldwide that are putting its Principles into action to make a difference for people and the planet through its performance. Mars brands include: Petcare – PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, BANFIELD® Pet Hospital, CESAR®, SHEBA®, DREAMIES® and NUTRO®; Chocolate – M&M’S®, SNICKERS®, DOVE®, GALAXY®, MARS®, MILKY WAY® and TWIX®; Wrigley – DOUBLEMINT®, EXTRA®, ORBIT® and 5™ chewing gums, SKITTLES® and STARBURST® candies, and ALTOIDS® AND LIFESAVERS® mints. Food – UNCLE BEN’S®, DOLMIO®, EBLY®, MASTERFOODS®, SEEDS OF CHANGE® and ROYCO®; Drinks – ALTERRA COFFEE ROASTERS™, THE BRIGHT TEA COMPANY™, KLIX® and FLAVIA®; Symbioscience – COCOAVIA® and WISDOM PANEL®.   M&M’S World Retail Store! M&M’S World...Work is better in color!   What could be better than joining the world's largest retail and entertainment complex dedicated to everything M&M’S® and supporting its success? We have immediate career opportunities for Retail Guest Experience Associates!   Come join our team in a venue rich in opportunity with fun at the center of it all. For an environment offering the experience of a lifetime, our store provides non-stop "retail-tainment" and allows you to see work in a marvelous, multi-colored new light! We offer a color-filled wall of M&M candies and thousands of M&M’S retail products throughout our fun-filled store.  To view a sample of our hardline, softline and plush retail products go to http://www.mmsworld.com/.   Purpose of Role:   The In- Store Visual Specialist is responsible for executing and maintaining the visual / merchandise placement standards and marketing as directed by the Corporate Office. This role is primarily focused on maintaining visual/merchandising standards for the store location as well as coordinating window display set up to ensuring that store is Big Bold and Branded and always visually exciting to our Guests   Principal Accountabilities:   DRIVE RESULTS / GUEST SERVICE- ACHIEVE OUR GOALS BY DELIVERING THE MOST FUN RETAIL AND GUEST EXPERIENCE Displays a "Guest comes first" attitude by training and holding associates accountable for delivering legendary service Enthusiastically approach all Guests with a Smile and say “Hello” Demonstrates understanding of retail metrics; celebrate success and make suggestions for improvement when necessary Exudes a positive attitude and sustains a contagious energy throughout entire shift   When working Onstage: Provides Guests with a basket to enhance their shopping experience Demonstrates pace with a sense of direction and purpose and actively approaches Guests Asks open ended questions to determine the Guests needs Shows focus items as well as add-ons or additional items Shares product knowledge including chocolate facts with Guests Directs Guests to other departments / floors throughout the building Offers shipping for large or fragile purchases Conducts product demonstrations as needed Contributes to and is knowledgeable of store sales goals and results Balances serving multiple Guests and completing multiple tasks   PRESENTATION EXCELLENCE- CREATE A VISUALLY EXCITING MERCHANDISE PRESENTATION BY DELIVERING OUR BRAND STANDARD PROMISE Collaborates with Corporate team to create and maintain merchandising standards Executes merchandise plans and displays as communicated by Corporate Visual Manager and buying team Ensures signage program is implemented and maintained to company standards Directs activities of visual support associate(s) or temporary help, as needed Executes visual elements based on seasonal plan/calendar for displays and windows as communicated by the Corporate Visual & Marketing teams Maintains a schedule to ensure all displays and visuals are kept clean and neat  Communicates gaps in product assortment to the Planning team so that alternates can be investigated Ensures presentation minimum standards are maintained, and update the Corporate Visual Merchandise Manager of gaps / holes / excess inventory   OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE- ENSURING OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCIES WHILE DELIVERING AN EXCITING RETAIL EXPERIENCE  Ensures all areas of the store Onstage and Backstage are neat clean, organized, operational and safe Complies with and ensures that all associates follow company policies and procedures In partnership with Store Director ensure that store is in compliance with all employment State and Federal laws, including but not limited to wage and hour and Equal Employment Opportunity Ensures that the store protects company assets thorough awareness of Loss Prevention best practices, including great guest service, associate bag checks, associate purchases, as well as all other compliance to company policies and procedures   PERSONAL LEADERSHIP- EXEMPLIFY LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES THAT DRIVE A HIGH PERFORMING, HIGHLY ENGAGED TEAM Trains new associates, as needed Must be on time for work and take breaks in timely manner Adheres to all dress code standards Ability to represent our brand appropriately and responsibly Ability to maintain standards in designated area of responsibility Ability to manage time at work effectively and efficiently Must be able to contribute to the success of the team in a positive way Sense of urgency in handling job responsibilities Exemplifies the Five Principles of Mars Be an inspiration to others, ethically and professionally Ability to develop personal skills and capability through on-going training, as provided by the company Supportive of management decisions Other duties as assigned by the management team   Key Functional Retail Knowledge Skills/Knowledge Guest Service Selling Merchandising Brand / Product Knowledge Store Operations Business Acumen Personnel Policies and Procedures Must be able to: bend/stoop/lift/reach placing visual props/merchandise as appropriate to the store environment, climb ladders, move fixtures, demonstrate knowledge and ability to use tools of the (power tools, knives, glue guns, hot wires, staple guns, hammer, screw drivers – as examples), prep merchandise for the sales floor to include opening/moving boxes of product    Key Experiences: Minimum 2 years experience working in a fast paced, high volume retail operation, with an emphasis on visual merchandising and  inventory flow   Desired Education High School Degree     Decision Making Authority and Impact Ability to make immediate decisions regarding customer service issues Ability to make recommendations to enhance operational and associate needs   About Mars Retail Group Headquartered in Mt. Arlington, New Jersey, U.S., the Mars Retail Group creates and builds retail businesses that build the brands of Mars, Incorporated.  The iconic M&M’S World® stores, located in New York City, Las Vegas, Orlando, London, and Shanghai, currently represent Mars’ largest retail business.  MRG also operates the company’s Licensing and Colorworks businesses. Mars Retail Group is a division of Mars, Incorporated.   About M&M'S World® Offering a wide range of M&M’S® Brand Chocolate Candies and merchandise, the M&M'S World® stores reflect the huge popularity of M&M'S®, the world's most popular confectionery brand.  The stores' merchandise includes apparel, kitchenware, plush, and glassware, as well as seasonal items and specially-designed M&M'S® branded items that reflect the personalities of the cities -- Las Vegas, New York City, Orlando, Henderson (Nevada), London and Shanghai -- where the stores are located.    About My M&M’S® MY M&M’S® Chocolate Candies (mymms.com) make special moments even more memorable by helping you showcase your creativity and thoughtfulness through personalization and customization. MY M&M’S come in 25 fun colors and you can make them truly special with personalized designs and packaging options. Exclusive printing options allow you to add your photos, select from a wide range of clip art images and even add unique messages right on the candy, for party favors, gifts and other DIY projects that are sure to be cherished. Job Description Role Profile Template   Position Title: Guest Experience Manager, M & M’s World Reports To: Store Director, M & M’s World   Purpose of Role:   The Guest Experience Manager is responsible for delivering an exceptional Guest experience from the first impression /greeting, to the Box Office. This role is primarily responsible to drive sales through a trained and engaged team of Onstage associates and through the accountability and follow up of the category champion program   Principal Accountabilities:    DRIVE RESULTS / GUEST SERVICE #- ACHIEVE OUR GOALS BY BRINGING MORE CHOCOLATE SMILES TO OUR GUESTS   Trains and develops Onstage sales, box office and merchandisers to ensure store meets and / or exceeds quantifiable performance metric’s (e.g. Net Sales, Conversion, Average Dollar Sale, etc.) Performs role of “category champion” to ensure proper product placement, replenishment, product knowledge and sales productivity Assesses, evaluates and coaches Onstage associates utilizing the Mars selling strategy to drive sales Role models the behaviors of an effective Manager on Duty to ensure achievement of all sales objectives and goals Adheres to “leadership” Onstage at all times  Manage Guest flow and wait times at the box office Open and close secondary registers as needed to optimize register productivity Encourages up-sell at register and facilitate grab-and-go sales by utilizing primary registers on floor Achieves positive results on mystery shop evaluations Displays a "Guest comes first" attitude by training and holding associates accountable for delivering legendary service Demonstrates understanding of retail metrics; celebrate success and make suggestions for improvement when necessary Exudes a positive attitude and sustains a contagious energy throughout entire shift   TALENT MANAGEMENT- DELIVER AN EXPECTIONAL RETAIL EXPERIENCE BY DELIGHTING OUR GUESTS THROUGH OUR FUN, KNOWLEDGE AND PASSION FOR OUR BRAND   Provides consistent, fair and timely feedback to associates through various channels, i.e. one on one opportunities, reviews, coaching, mentoring, training Trains and educates associates on new product knowledge, selling strategies and new merchandise presentation techniques Coaches associates in the moment to reward outstanding results / behaviors and to correct and improve developmental opportunities Manages the content and delivery of pre-shift meetings; rotate meetings to be both educational and entertaining Manages a group of assigned associates including Onstage: Sales, Box Office, Merchandisers and Supervisors ensuring clear expectations are communicated, results are followed up and accountability is applied Ensures all associates are upbeat, engaging and fun, if not take action   PRESENTATION EXCELLENCE- CREATE A VISUALLY EXCITING MERCHANDISE PRESENTATION BY DELIVERING OUR BRAND STANDARD PROMISE   Demonstrates knowledge of products, placement Onstage, sales impact according to the space occupied and general understanding of category components In partnership with Store Director and corporate team ensures proper and effective training and development is provided to associates to achieve an exceptionally visually appealing store that is Big, Bold and clearly branded   OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE- ENSURING OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCES WHILE DELIVERING AN EXCITING RETAIL EXPERIENCE     Ensures all areas of the store including Onstage and Backstage are neat clean, organized, operational and safe Complies with and ensures that all associates follow company policies and procedures In partnership with Store Director ensure that store is in compliance with all employment State and Federal laws, including but not limited to wage and hour and Equal Employment Opportunity Ensures that the store protects company assets thorough awareness of Loss Prevention best practices, including great guest service, associate bag checks, associate purchases, as well as all other compliance to company policies and procedures   PERSONAL LEADERSHIP- EXEMPLIFY LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES THAT DRIVE A HIGH PERFORMING, HIGHLY ENGAGED TEAM   Be an inspiration to others, ethically and professionally Demonstrates confidence and focus during periods of high volume or unexpected events to keep store operating to standard and to set a positive example for the store team Share information and communicate clearly to all levels Lead by managing through change and adversity Exemplifies the 5 Principles of Mars Promotes store involvement in Mars community service, wellness and sustainability programs Cultivates a collaborative learning environment within the store by modeling purpose, values and behaviors consistent with Mars philosophy Helps to drive consensus while managing a diverse management team and/or collaborating with colleagues in other stores/departments  Provides an open door policy where associates are free to express their ideas, concerns and feelings and an environment where the 5 principles of Mars are modeled and upheld   Mission Critical Competencies Integrity and Trust Approachability Drive for Results Directing and Motivating Others Interpersonal Savvy Customer Focus Creativity (solution oriented) Building Effective Teams   Key Functional Retail Knowledge Skills/Knowledge Guest Service Selling Merchandising Brand / Product Knowledge Store Operations Business Acumen Personnel Policies and Procedures   Key Experiences Minimum 2 years experience managing in a fast paced, high volume retail operation   Desired Education College Degree or equivalent experience   Decision Making Authority and Impact Ability to make immediate decisions as it relates to driving sales and satisfying the Guest Ability to make immediate decisions regarding associate issues, store policy and procedure issues and guest service recovery Ability to make recommendations to enhance operational and associate needs   People Management Responsibility Direct (management associates)   Direct (non-management associates) 20-30   Indirect (management Principal Accountabilities: Carry out QFS and RD conformance record reviews to ensure product compliance with release criteria. Effectively communicate and manage EMQM holds, and product non-conformances Drives efficiency with consumer contact reporting by keeping track of CCI’s, following up with EM’s on status, closure, and reporting back to BU. Maintains EMPRA’s, and all Technical Specifications, EMQM audits, Capas for the EMQM team to include schedules for reviews, updates. Is responsible to post the above documents to relevant locations. (sharepoint). Supports team with EMQM scheduling/ calendar, maintains corrective actions from audits, and  CAPA effectiveness verification for each EM, T5’s for external suppliers as needed with any global standard updates. Maintains quarterly global metric reporting to EMQM sharepoint site. Updates BU on status of EM metrics per quarter. ADC shelf life Document Management Manages EM team calendar   Responsible for communicating and elevating any quality and food safety concerns to EM QFS Manager This position and all associates are responsible for quality and food safety.  Other similar duties as assigned Key Functional Skills/Knowledge Strong oral, listening, and written communication skills in order to communicate with all levels of the organization Strong project management and planning skills with proven ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously. Strong interpersonal communication and leadership skills, and the ability to effectively negotiate, influence, and persuade.  Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills.  Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence, and motivate. Ability to work independently without supervision as well as within a team setting. Ability to work different schedules as needed for testing and projects. Ability to travel 10% Desired Education/Preferred Qualifications  High school diploma or equivalent plus 2-3 years’ work or military experience (manufacturing environment preferred).  Working knowledge of Food Safety, Regulatory, and Good Manufacturing Practices. Working knowledge of processes and packaging of pet food products. Proficient and demonstrated skills in Sharepoint.  Ability and aptitude to work in an R&D, Manufacturing, and/or Distribution environment Strong understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP's), Good Laboratory Practices (GLP's), Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point Systems (HACCP), ISO, Regulatory Guidelines, and/or Microbiology  Proficient math, reading, and writing skills  Knowledge of the Windows working environment including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The primary purpose of a Maintenance Technician is to maintain conditions of operating equipment. Secondary tasks include the repair or replacement of failed components, the ability to troubleshoot unknown issues with equipment, and make adjustments to centerline operational output of assigned equipment.   Perform all mechanical and electrical P.M.s on various manufacturing and packaging equipment and electrical panels; then document WO’s/PM’s using computerized maintenance management system (SAP Plant Maintenance). Other duties include some fabrication, welding, and machinist skills, as trained and as required. Troubleshooting and repairing routine electrical and mechanical problems on assigned equipment, conduct preventative maintenance, and support Operations in equipment setup and changeover. Troubleshoot and repair equipment including electrical components including motor starters, switches and sensors found on all assigned equipment using basic test equipment such as multi-meters, amp probes, basic hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical drive systems at the component level on all assigned equipment; i.e. packaging, conveying, processing, or facilities equipment, etc. Participate in TPM Teams, train operators in AM activities, and conduct Breakdown Analysis.   Essential Functions A technical diploma in Industrial Maintenance or related field is a plus. Minimum of 2 years of maintenance experience in a manufacturing environment. Understand and adhere to LOTO, Confined Space, and all other plant safety/GMP requirements related to supporting machinery uptime. Understand TPM Theory and Concepts. Possess a fundamental understanding of electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic schematics, and mechanical drawings in order to solve problems in a timely manner. Basic Computer skills required Requires basic machinist skills, metal smith work, plumbing and steam fitting. Capable of operating assigned equipment. Work in confined spaces as required and adhere to regulations and policies covering confined space. (Mechanics working in confined space are required to learn Basic First Aid and CPR.) Conduct “hot work” permit work as necessary to include grinding and/or welding as trained and as required. Be multi-crafted with skills including functional electrical power and controls, understanding of PLCs, mechanical, print reading, etc.   Physical Requirements Frequent pushing / pulling *(50-300 lbs) Frequent bending and stooping Frequent lifting / carrying (10-50 lbs.) Frequent handling / gripping (parts, tools, etc.)   This position requires completion of  the Standard Timing Model assessement and a Georgia Work Keys Certification.   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. This role will encompass the terrtirioy from Greenville, NC to Wilmington, NC.   Purpose of Role  To drive accelerated growth in the Veterinary Business Pillar by achieving strategic goals through making direct calls on Veterinary Clinics and identifying opportunities which develop new business and increase points of distribution. Principal Accountabilities • Achieve profitable sales growth objectives within assigned territory. • Utilizing strong selling skills, develop and understand customer needs to increase clinic penetration and growth of RC diets. • Develop and maintain strong customer relationships with key individuals within the clinic. • Identify potential clinics and set strategies to align customers for recommending RC diets as their primary therapeutic diet for their clients/patients. • Identify opportunities and strategies to develop new business within assigned territory. • Develop and maintain a high technical competency for RC diets as well as competitive therapeutic diets. • Conduct high level of customer service within assigned territory by responding to customer inquiries in a timely and professional manner. • Collaborate with your team and other company associates to provide valuable contributions to the company and within your regional team that give insightful views from your customers. • Effectively execute the Veterinary Business Unit sales strategy within assigned territory. • Deliver effective sales presentations during customer meetings that result in increased sku penetration and growth. • Attend and participate in trade shows, regional and company meetings/conference calls as required. • Complete weekly activity reports, expense reports, and any requested information as directed by your manager. • Manage expenses to stay within all budget areas provided by your manager. Minimum Requirements: • High School Diploma • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or Veterinary Science or equivalent experience • Strong computer skills in using Excel, Word, and Powerpoint • Excellent verbal and written communication as well as interpersonal skills. • Ability to travel 30% Preferred Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or Veterinary Science • Veterinary Hospital experience • 2+ years B2B sales and/or vet hospital experience • Salesforce skills a plus • Outside sales experience   Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

JobTitle: Bilingual Part Time Retail Sales Consultant
JobText: $500 Sign on Bonus:  PART TIME RETAIL SALES CONSULTANTFOR SELECT AT&T STORES ONLY.$500 Sign-On Bonus offered.Not applicable to internal employees.  To be eligible you must be hired by AT&T for one of the location(s) listed above.  AT&T reserves the right, at its discretion, to pay your 1st portion of the bonus payments after 30 days of your first date of employment = $250 , and the second payment after you complete 6 months of employment = $250.  Total payouts= $500.  Your receipt of these bonus payouts are contingent upon your agreement with the terms set forth under Agreement for Repayment of Sign On Bonus and in general, provides that you will repay the bonus if you voluntarily terminate your employment within 12 months of the first day of your employment. Program ends 8/15/2017.This position is part time! What does that mean? Flexibility, balance, control! Are you interested in pursuing a new, exciting career but cannot commit full time? AT&T understands! Our part-time careers allow you the time to manage your schedule including days that you designate as your own each week!Do you like helping people?
