Join us in the big leagues!AT&T is a world leader in communications, business solutions, and entertainment.  As part of our Business Sales teams, you'll work with small to large enterprises and government agencies to sell our full-scale business solutions.Our wireless division serves 95 percent of the Fortune 100 companies, accounts for more than 80 percent of the Fortune 500 and has more than 1200 federal, state, and local government agencies as our customers.You'll be part of the team that walks our customers through AT&T's cutting-edge products, shows them the benefit of our advanced services, and ultimately closes the deal. We aren't just the phone company anymore and you aren't just any sales person.  This could be your chance to join a company that's known for being innovative, successful and ahead of the curve.With AT&T's history of success and commitment to emerging technologies, this is the ideal sales environment for a professional looking to build an amazing career.Develops new accounts and maintains current accounts.  May be assigned a key account, group of accounts, or specific geographic area.  Fully knowledgeable of assigned company products/services. Demonstrates a broad knowledge of the organization's entire product line. Establishes and maintains contacts and rapport with customer and prospects.  May establish long-term relationship with accounts/clients.  Seasoned in-depth knowledge of functional/process area; considered a subject matter expert. Viewed as a mentor or coach. Work performed with limited guidance.  Desired Requirements:·         Prefers a minimum of 3-5 years of telecommunications experience.  Required Qualifications:Valid driver's license with satisfactory driving record Current auto insurance Reliable vehicle per transportation needs of market

As a DIRECTV Technician - Installation, you will be responsible for providing our customers excellent service through installing, troubleshooting, and upgrading satellite TV systems.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include:Preparing for installations by reviewing installation orders, gathering equipment, supplies and tools and coordinating schedules with customers.Planning installations by evaluating location, locating access and laying-out equipment and wiring plan.Establishing satellite TV systems by installing equipment, running and pulling cable, programming and calibrating equipment while adhering to codes, regulations and standards.Verifying satellite TV systems for correct functionality and optimal performance by testing equipment and connections and identifying and correcting any issues.Maintaining accurate records through documenting installations, services and repairs.Maintaining and improving service and rapport with customers through listening to their descriptions of problems, answering questions and resolving issues through diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, replacing and/or upgrading components.Referring to schematics, manuals and manufacturer's instructions as needed.Maintaining a safe work environment by following safe practices and adhering to safety policies.Ensuring adequate supply levels by inventorying stock, placing and verifying orders.Updating and improving job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading technical publications.Enhancing the organization's reputation through personal accountability for accomplishing new and different requests and always striving to add value.Other duties as assigned.QualificationsMust possess a valid driver's license in the primary state of residenceMust be able to speak clearly, concisely, and to communicate effectively in a courteous and professional mannerSolid written communication skills requiredMust be able to work full time, up to and including six days a week; which may include nights, weekends, and holidays, as requiredMust meet company hiring criteria for pre-employment screening, including drug test, criminal background check, fitness for duty, and MVR checkMust be able to obtain all necessary certifications, including SBCA, Service, SW iM, and Ka/Ku, as requiredWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office and inventory software systems preferredSBCA and/or other industry certifications preferredSix months experience in telecommunications, electrical, construction, or related field preferredWorking knowledge of handheld electronics, including smart phones, iPads, etc., preferred.Must be able to lift up to 80 pounds and climb ladders up to 40 feet in lengthMust be able to work in tight spaces, including attics and crawl spacesMust be able to work outside in extreme weather conditions, including precipitation and temperature variationsMust be able to stand for extended periods of timeAn essential duty of the position of Technician is to install satellite dishes with the use of a ladder on customers ‘homes. The ladders used by DIRECTV have been rated by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) to hold a maximum total weight (including tool belt and equipment)of 375 lbs. To allow for the weight of equipment an individual's weight cannot exceed 275 lbs.*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The qualifications and requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

LOOKING FOR A COMPANY THAT VALUES YOUR POTENTIAL?A job with AT&T as a Splicing Technician can provide you with exactly that! Take advantage of our paid training and wide range of career possibilities. AT&T offers a competitive salary, company provided vehicles and tools and benefits that include medical, dental, paid vacation, and more!Our Splicing Technicians install, maintain and repair services for our customers.What you'll do as an AT&T Splicing Technician:Install, disconnect and upgrade customer services Make and complete splices in various types of communication cables Review and analyze complex schematic drawings Use electrical test instruments to determine defective wire or fiber Repair and maintain outside cable facilities May climb poles and ladders or operate hydraulic aerial lifts mounted on trucks Work outdoors in all kinds of weather Our Splicing Technicians must have the following:Valid state drivers license Non-negligent driving record Meet 275lbs weight limit due to safety restrictions Ability to perceive differences in wire and cable colors Ability to lift and move up to 100lbs Satisfactory results from a background/employment history investigation and drug screening Qualify on pre-employment screening Study Guides(click the links below to open the various study guides)Assessment Information:Technical/Mechanical Test III (TMT III)Background Check Information:Physical Abilities Evaluation (PAE)

As a DIRECTV Technician - Installation, you will be responsible for providing our customers excellent service through installing, troubleshooting, and upgrading satellite TV systems.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include:Preparing for installations by reviewing installation orders, gathering equipment, supplies and tools and coordinating schedules with customers.Planning installations by evaluating location, locating access and laying-out equipment and wiring plan.Establishing satellite TV systems by installing equipment, running and pulling cable, programming and calibrating equipment while adhering to codes, regulations and standards.Verifying satellite TV systems for correct functionality and optimal performance by testing equipment and connections and identifying and correcting any issues.Maintaining accurate records through documenting installations, services and repairs.Maintaining and improving service and rapport with customers through listening to their descriptions of problems, answering questions and resolving issues through diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, replacing and/or upgrading components.Referring to schematics, manuals and manufacturer's instructions as needed.Maintaining a safe work environment by following safe practices and adhering to safety policies.Ensuring adequate supply levels by inventorying stock, placing and verifying orders.Updating and improving job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading technical publications.Enhancing the organization's reputation through personal accountability for accomplishing new and different requests and always striving to add value.Other duties as assigned.QualificationsMust possess a valid driver's license in the primary state of residenceMust be able to speak clearly, concisely, and to communicate effectively in a courteous and professional mannerSolid written communication skills requiredMust be able to work full time, up to and including six days a week; which may include nights, weekends, and holidays, as requiredMust meet company hiring criteria for pre-employment screening, including drug test, criminal background check, fitness for duty, and MVR checkMust be able to obtain all necessary certifications, including SBCA, Service, SW iM, and Ka/Ku, as requiredWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office and inventory software systems preferredSBCA and/or other industry certifications preferredSix months experience in telecommunications, electrical, construction, or related field preferredWorking knowledge of handheld electronics, including smart phones, iPads, etc., preferred.Must be able to lift up to 80 pounds and climb ladders up to 40 feet in lengthMust be able to work in tight spaces, including attics and crawl spacesMust be able to work outside in extreme weather conditions, including precipitation and temperature variationsMust be able to stand for extended periods of timeAn essential duty of the position of Technician is to install satellite dishes with the use of a ladder on customers ‘homes. The ladders used by DIRECTV have been rated by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) to hold a maximum total weight (including tool belt and equipment)of 375 lbs. To allow for the weight of equipment an individual's weight cannot exceed 275 lbs.*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The qualifications and requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The Senior App Sales Executive 3 Hunter is responsible for serving as a subject matter expert in driving new & incremental revenue generation on named accounts, and sale of complex/technical products, services, applications, and/or solutions. Key Roles and Responsibilities:Develops strategic plans related to the customer and the proposed solution/sale.Provides subject matter expertise regarding technical issues relating to sales.Advises customers on suitability of products based on customer requirements. Prepares proposals, presentations, or bids, including developing pricing, to highly complex solutions. Researches and develops customer solutions with AT&T external partners, including design and engineering. May manage and coordinate the sales and/or technical team in support of the sale of highly complex products and services to a customer. These complex products/services are a priority for the company and requires specific focus and expertise. Responsible for consulting with direct sales teams and customers to provide expertise regarding the design, customization, implementation and account management of highly technical products/services/applications/solutions.Spends some time at the customer premise developing and presenting sales proposals and systems solutions. Requires extensive knowledge of company products and services. Assists less experienced peers. Expertise in Networking for IP Conferencing, SIP & VPNSupervisory: NoRequired Skills and Qualifications:Minimum 5 years strong sales experienceComplex telecom sales and/or technical sales support to business customers experienceCustomer problem resolution experienceExperience developing business relationships at C-levelProven success in driving new and incremental revenue Proven experience as a high performer Account Planning experienceExperience working in a cross functional role with other sales account managersOverlay sales experienceValid driver's license with satisfactory driving recordCurrent auto insuranceReliable vehicle per transportation needs of marketDesired Skills and Education:Bachelors or Advanced degree preferredExperience supporting international accounts a plus

Systems and Data Analyst 3 Apply Job ID 469 Date posted 06/17/2017 Location Englewood COLORADO United States Job Description Summary: Jeppesen has an opening in a high profile, fast paced and exciting environment with tremendous growth and learning potential: The Azure Cloud Development Program is looking for a level 3 Systems and Data Analyst to support systems definition and design activities to secure the DA Azure Environment. The preferred candidate will have experience with systems architecture, information protection and security analysis. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate to executive leadership, be proactive and willing to work collaboratively within and across multiple teams.  Essential Duties: Performs research, analysis and documentation on data classifications, network designs, application code/encoding, applications and systems.  Identifies and analyzes data/systems vulnerabilities and remediation. Provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.  Develop solutions that are imaginative, thorough, practicable, and consistent with organization objectives.  Provides and collects status updates from multiple teams collaborating on effort(s). Provides communication to senior level leadership members. Provides coordination and facilitation for DA Azure security and compliance based meetings and engagements Provides SCRUM Master oversight and management of DA Azure Security and Compliance backlog Education/Experience:  Technical bachelor's degree and typically 6 or more years' related work experience or a Master's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A technical degree is defined as any four year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study. Knowledge and Skills: IT/Systems/Software Architecture & Analysis background Information protection/security background Excellent analytical skills Excellent writing skills Excellent verbal communication Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills Division Jeppeson Apply

IT Systems Analyst Apply Company The Boeing Company Job ID 1700006798 Date posted 06/16/2017 Location Renton Washington United States Job Description The HR, SSG, and Corporate Systems organization is seeking a highly motivated individual to join our Functional Analyst team in Renton. Our team is working to innovate many of our IT solutions by leveraging mobility, cloud, SaaS, etc. Our applications are used across the globe and with all levels of staff, so strong communication skills and business acumen are desirable. In this role you will be a functional systems analyst serving as a liaison between the customer and the IT team. You will be collaborating with the customer to understand the business, facilitate requirements definition and system design, work with the development team, lead functional testing, and troubleshoot issues to successfully support system releases. Additionally you will work in a Plan/Build and Run environment on the Plan/Build side of the team. As part of this role you may be required to coordinate production errors by communicating issues to the Run team and assisting as required.To be successful in this role you should be a self-starter with strong leadership skills and the ability to build strong relationships with customers to understand their business needs in order to implement functionality that drives increased business value.  Great analytical skills are desired with the ability to “think outside the box” to recommend innovative solutions.  Researches and performs basic analysis of processes, applications, systems and data to identify functional requirements for application or system design. Assists customers to clarify basic requirements. Interprets and translates routine requirements into functional specifications. Assists in the development and execution of moderately complex tests to validate system functionality against specifications.Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world. Division CIO, Information & Analytics Relocation Assistance Available No. Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit. Qualifications Basic Qualifications (Required):1+ year of experience working in a functional analyst roleExperience in requirements gathering/definitionDesired Experience/Qualifications:Prior experience performing software functional testing Knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle.Typical Education/Experience:Technical bachelor's degree and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or a Master's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A technical degree is defined as any four year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study.This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Experience Level Individual Contributor Job Type Standard Travel Yes, 10 % of the Time Contingent Upon Program Award No Union No Job Code BAMAN2 Apply

Proprietary Systems Administrator Apply Company The Boeing Company Job ID 1700008494 Date posted 06/16/2017 Location Saint Louis Missouri United States Job Description The Boeing Company is currently seeking an experienced Proprietary Systems Administrator to join the Information Technology division in St. Louis, MO.   In this role you will work with a diverse range of both people and systems.In this role you will:Provide comprehensive end-to-end computing support in closed environments from the desktops to the servers. Provide broad range of basic systems and application support. Protect classified and proprietary information. Support security audits as assigned. Maintain knowledge of various government and corporate security plans. Installation and integration of Windows operating systems and related COTS products. Develop PowerShell and Linux scripts to enable consistent, high-quality integration of hardware assets. Evaluate and effectively communicating complex system problems and resolution. Perform integration of security solutions (McAfee, Splunk, HBSS) into information systems. Administer user system access and establishing safeguards to protect information to meet security requirements. Troubleshoot operating system and installation problems. Support architecture design studies for technology implementation. Maintain awareness of and participating in the planning and execution of upgrades and patches for operating systems and COTS software. Architect, install, and administer storage, backup, and network infrastructure needs (NetApp, SolarWinds, BackupExec, etc). Create and maintain multiple virtual servers based on VMWare. Provide on-site, in-person hardware installation, cabling, and configuration.Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world. Division CIO, Information & Analytics Relocation Assistance Available No. Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit. Qualifications Basic Qualifications (Required):An active Secret U.S. Security Clearance (Applicants must include their Security Clearance Level, Investigation Type and Investigation Date clearly on their resume).3+  years of experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and administering support for Windows OS.Installation and troubleshooting experience with one or more of the following: Splunk, ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO) or HBSS, SolarWinds. Experience writing PowerShell or other scripts to automate deployment and configuration of operating systems. Prior experience with hardware installation and troubleshooting.Desired Qualifications:CompTIA Security+ certified (or similar certification meeting DoD Directive 8570.01 Certification Requirements) Required post-start. Prior experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and administering support for Unix OS and Linux OSLinux RHEL 6 or higher experience. Experience troubleshooting Group Policy Objects (GPO). Architecture, design, and installation/support experience with Cisco-backed networks.Typical Education/Experience:Technical bachelor's degree and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or a Master's degree with typically 3 or more years' or a PhD degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A technical degree is defined as any four year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study. Additional Information:Position is contingent on security clearance approval. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.   This position requires an active (or ability to obtain) U.S. Security Clearance, for which the US Government requires US Citizenship.   This particular position requires a CURRENT SECRET security clearance as well as the ability to obtain program specific access.  Candidates must include their current clearance level clearly on their resume.     At least one year of experience working with configuration management principles and processes is required. Experience using ClearQuest and ClearCase for Software Configuration Management activities is required.   Must be willing to relocate to the St Louis area at own expense. Experience Level Entry Level Job Type Standard Travel Yes, 10 % of the Time Contingent Upon Program Award No Union No Job Code 6D2EP2 Apply

Starliner Communication Specialist Apply Company The Boeing Company Job ID 1700008419 Date posted 06/16/2017 Location Kennedy Space Center Florida United States Job Description This position is for an experienced communications specialist to join the Boeing CST-100 Starliner program communications team. This position reports to the BDS Development Communications senior manager and is located at Boeing’s Commercial Crew and Cargo Facility (C3PF) facility at Kennedy Space Center. This candidate, along with a teammate, will be responsible for internal, external, site, executive and program communications for the program and will coordinate closely with other space and BDS Development programs. This role is accomplished through close collaboration with the communications teammate, and through hands-on engagement with program and executive leadership teams. The candidate must be independent and responsible to cultivate and successfully produce multiple projects under self-motivated direction and on critical time lines, while capable of keeping your communications teammate aware and informed.   Responsibilities include helping team: Provide day-to-day communications support for Starliner program  Focus on internal employee engagement activities (Executive Speaker Series, employee, corporate and citizenship/community responsibilities) and assist w/Florida site communicationsExecute communications plan integrating Space Exploration and BDS Development messagingSupport businesses through proficient creative writing, social media, videotape/still imagery assets placed internally and externallyContinue to build strong customer and relationship building skills with customers, suppliers and NASA Public Affairs personnel Advance Starliner message and presentation creation supporting trade shows, executive leadership events, speeches  and outreach (round tables, industry conference panels)Engage news media through solid outreach skills to propel messaging as requiredMonitor competitive assets and report to program and functional leadershipMulti-task and keep projects on course and on time (includes occasional work outside normal business hours and travel to meet deadlines and fulfill projects)Ensure communications team attends weekly leadership and business staff meetingsTravel to support programs and businesses, with potential international travel expected   Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.   Division Communications Relocation Assistance Available Yes. Available for eligible candidates, if authorized. Qualifications Typical education/experience:Bachelor's and typically 6 or more years' related work experience, a Master's degree and typically 4 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Basic Required Qualifications: More than 3 years experience working on a team developing communications strategies for space exploration programs including executive speeches, employee communications, news releases and web content.Experience working with the external news media, preferably, the NASA press corps and space-related media. This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Experience Level Individual Contributor Job Type Standard Travel Yes, 10 % of the Time Contingent Upon Program Award No Union No Job Code 4A34P3 Apply

JobText: Data Analyst Apply Job ID 10572 Date posted 06/17/2017 Location Rancho Cucamonga CA US Job Description Job Description: Data Analyst Come join a Team that’s Growing. They are a dynamic team of Engineers on the move. Our engineering services team is leading the way for modern aircraft interiors and helping to provide critical data when airlines and operators need it most. Our culture is open and inclusive. This role receives, manages, formats, and distributes data to aid internal and external customers in development of engineering products, processes, and services. Collects data and assists customers in development of engineering data. Makes use of standard processes to meet conformance and compliance on regulatory and contractual fronts. Ensures consistent quality in products, processes and services. Works for verification of products and documents and ensures defects are properly identified and routed for resolution. Keeps customers in the loop with constant communication. Assists with inputs to online data stores. Works under supervision. Coordinates and interfaces with customers. Develops dashboards, metrics and reports using various techniques to meet business objectives and to support overall process efficiency and effectiveness. Provides administrative assistance in audits. Assists in identification and validation of user access roles. EDUCATION: AA Degree in related discipline EXPERIENCE: 1+ Years of Experience. Experience as a Data Manager in engineering field preferred. SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES: Strong PC skills with high proficiency in Windows and Microsoft Office products functionality Microsoft Project and Visio skills desirable Advanced Microsoft Excel skills preferred Attention to detail required Ability to learn new applications quickly Ability to prioritize for maximum productivity for multiple projects Ability to define and document processes as required Ability to identify potential issues, analyze and recommend improvements and alternate solutions Ability to follow written and verbal instructions Good verbal and written communication skills Good organizational skills Proven reasoning, analytical abilities and mechanical aptitude ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES Manages data (including receives, manages, formats, and distributes) for internal and external customers Prepares metrics and reports Collects data and assists customers in development of engineering data Assists with inputs to online data stores Provides administrative assistance in audits Assists in identification and validation of user access roles Develop solutions that are imaginative, thorough, practical, and consistent with organization objectives Locate source data from the applicable files and systems Perform detailed analysis and interpretation of source data and make corrections as appropriate Interact frequently with inter-organizational personnel and external customers. Represents the organization by providing solutions to issues associated with specific projects Use analytical skills to determine solutions and resolve problems Adhere to established styles and procedures Meet assigned schedules and deadlines Meet production and quality standards Perform other duties as assigned Ability to travel for training or assignments as required CDG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Drug Free: We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. US Person: Yes. Due to legal requirements associated with our work statements, you must be able to provide documentation indicating that you are a US Person. We offer a competitive salary, great benefits, and a pleasant working environment. Division CDG Job Type Full-Time Apply

JobTitle: P8 Training Systems Pilot Subject Matter Expert 4
JobText: P8 Training Systems Pilot Subject Matter Expert 4 Apply Company The Boeing Company Job ID 1700008614 Date posted 06/16/2017 Location Saint Louis Missouri United States Job Description Boeing Training Systems and Government Services (TSGS) is looking for Training Systems Pilot Subject Matter Expert Support Analyst 3. This position will be located in St Louis, MO to support P-8A U.S. Navy and P-8 Australia program. Selected candidate will support software delivery testing and device acceptance testing for the Operational Flight Trainer (OFT) devices, as well as, follow-on software upgrades to those devices.  The candidate may cross train to other devices as well. Candidate will be asked to support test activities for P-8A U.S. Navy and P-8 Australia training devices to include software and hardware acceptance testing at facilities in St. Louis, MO; Jacksonville, FL; Whidbey Island, WA and Australia with potential for new customers and devices including India and UK. Responsibilities include: * Write Acceptance Test Procedures (ATPs) * Work with Simulator supplier to perform testing prior to delivery to Boeing on flight simulator to ensure quality is high * Perform testing on simulator once converted from a 737 to a P-8 to ensure the simulator functions as per the aircraft in a Level D environment * Test previously discovered anomalies to ensure they were in fact fixed * Write test reports * Support development teams as the SME related to Flight Operations * Mentor/Cross Train other team members The successful candidate will: * Review/edit subsystem and system level requirements and design. * Create and status discrepancy reports for failed requirements. * Analyze, review, and validate test data and acceptance test procedures. * Prepare and publish user-level documentation, customer-based presentations, and tracking metrics. * Listens and demonstrates understanding; clarifies meaning for others; speaks with clarity and precision; able to communicate with a diverse audience; writes clearly and concisely. * Interface with other members of project or program teams, management, and technical staff to define and implement engineering solutions. * Work under minimal direction. Candidate must be type rated in a 737, P3 or P8 aircraft or have P8 OFT Simulator experience, though the candidate will not be flying aircraft.   Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world. Division Global Services & Support Relocation Assistance Available Yes. Available for eligible candidates, if authorized. Qualifications Degree and typical experience in engineering classification: Bachelor's and 9 or more years' experience, Master's with 7 or more years' experience or PhD with 4 or more years' experience. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.   Typical candidate will have experience in the following areas:   Previous experience as a 737/P-8/P-3 pilot. Ability to test and be familiar with anti-submarine/anti-ship capabilities of the P-8 in the flight simulator. Preferred candidates should have a minimum of a Technical bachelor's degree in one of the following fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Aviation Management, Math, Computer Programming, Systems Engineering or Systems Integration or other such field. Pilot Instructor experience in P-8A, P-3C, or other airborne Anti Submarine Warfare (ASW) capable platform. Operational experience with deployed P-8A. P-8 training systems experience. Experience using P-8A Aircrew Training Devices (such as WTT, PTT, OFT, MSDT, Electronic Classrooms (ECs).   Must have an active (or are you able to obtain) a U.S. Security Clearance, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. Must be a United States Person as defined by 22 C.F.R.  § 120.15?  “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.       Experience Level Individual Contributor Job Type Standard Travel Yes, 25 % of the Time Contingent Upon Program Award No Union No Job Code 6K8CP4 Apply

Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. At our core is a commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities. We offer unparalleled growth and development opportunities for our team members. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and we’re committed to providing that technology to people and organizations everywhere, so they can transform the way they work and live. Virtustream is trusted by enterprises and public sector organizations around the world to run and manage their mission-critical applications in the cloud. The company’s infrastructure-as-a-service solutions are built to address the complete spectrum of enterprise workloads, support hybrid cloud architectures with seamless integration into on-premises private clouds, and offer a full-stack management capability of infrastructure and application managed services that span on- and off-premises infrastructure. Virtustream is headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland with innovation and development centers in Palo Alto, Atlanta, Waldorf, Germany; Sofia, Bulgaria and Bangalore, India. The company has sales and delivery offices in Hopkinton, Dallas, Cork, London, Frankfurt, Tokyo and Sydney with data center locations around the world.Enablement Coordination Project Manager (USA based)The person fulfilling this position will have 7-10 years IT experience with 3-5 years of experience with standardized IT services that can be sold as a “product.” Specific experience areas may include sales, sales management, marketing with focus on field enablement marketing, field enablement. The preferred candidate will also have 1-3 years of project management experience. PM certification is a plus.This job will entail tracking the go to market readiness of new services offerings, and changes to services offerings that would impact enablement assets. In addition this person will review assets for completeness, understandability, and market differentiation. Enablement assets will include both internal and external facing presentations, documents, and contracts to ensure completeness for the sales field. Tracking the go to market readiness will involve running a bi-weekly Go to Market readiness meeting, with a regular weekly tracking report update. Ad hoc meetings may be required and will be managed by this person. Interactions will be regular with product management, product marketing, legal, pricing, and key field leaders.When you choose our company, you join a diverse world of innovative thought leaders. At our core is a commitment to workplace diversity, the sustainability of our planet, and community corporate involvement. We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities-all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, genetics, or citizenship status (when otherwise legally authorized to work) and will not be discriminated against on the basis of such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We encourage applicants of all ages.

Communicates to all DELL concerned parties any existing or potential customer escalation issues. Proactively follows the DELL escalation and change control process. Prepares, maintains and submits activity/progress reports and time recording/management reports in accordance with published procedures. Holds responsibility for achieving the EMC Bar of Excellence as the highest level of Customer Satisfaction. Stays abreast of current industry trends and new technology through professional associations, trade journals, networking, and associated training and seminars. Articulates the full value of the DELL Solutions and DELL Services business benefit to the customer. Provides a single point of contact during the project for all aspects of the engagement. Ensures a strong and seamless relationship by maintaining communications about the project to the team: sales, customers and delivery personnel. Financial and analytical experience. Communication skills. Leadership Skills. We provide challenge and opportunity for personal and professional development. We recognize the difference you bring to our business and together we share the pride of building one of the world’s largest leaders in logistics and supply chain solutions.SummaryDHL is offering one exceptional candidate the chance to support all production systems running in IT Services at our Mechanicsburg, PA datacenter.  In this role, you will be responsible for first line operational support in a Tier 3 server team.  You will provide proactive maintenance and administration of computer hardware, software and operational tools.  Additional qualifications and responsibilities include:Qualifications: ·4 or more years of experience in an IT infrastructure environment, or equivalent education in a related field·Working in a large company datacenter supporting 5,000+ servers in a complex hosting environment.·Great customer service skills: delivering respect and results to your customer.  Ability to work well in a team·Systems support experience with Windows Server 2003/2008/2012/2016·Working knowledge of NTFS/share permissions and DFS namespaces·Comfortable providing support in a large and diversified VMware environment·Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively·Ability to handle multiple tasks in an extremely fast-paced environment·Must be detail oriented, committed to deadlines, and have solid verbal and written communication skills·Experience working with Global ServiceNow in an ITIL environment preferred Key Responsibilities: ·Document best practices and adhere to formal standards and processes·Gather, assess, and communicate critical information to a broad set of teams·Assist with production and project management activities·Provide 3rd level support of systems running in IT Services·Maintain effective relationships with customers ·Champion continuous improvement and innovation·Understand and follow DPDHL Business Knowledge·Contribute to the maintenance and installation work in IT Operations.·Use system and network management tools to collect performance statistics·Investigate minor security breaches and assist with defining user access rights and privilegesDPDHL is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.​  If you would like to be considered for this elite organization, please submit your resume and cover letter online.

Location Milledgeville - GA - US Description Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans   Enterprise Rent-A-Car is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company with over 8,600 branch offices worldwide, Enterprise ranks #1 in the Insurance Replacement Market with yearly revenues of over $16 billion. The Service Agent cleans vehicles inside and out (vehicles may be cleaned by hand or by operating washing equipment). The Service Agent also performs regular maintenance (non-mechanical services), moves vehicles, and performs other duties assigned by the manager, all completed in a safe and timely manner. This position is located at 2485 North Columbia Street Milledgeville, GA.  The rate of pay for this position is $9.00/hourly. This is a part time position with an average of 20-25 hours (per week) depending on schedule. The potential candidate must be able to work one of the following shifts: Shift A: Monday 7:30am - 6:00pm, Wednesday 11:00am - 6:00pm, Friday 7:45am - 6:00pm, Saturday  (rotating) 8:30am - 12:00pm  Shift B: Monday 7:30am - 6:00pm, Thursday 11:00am - 6:00pm, Friday 7:45am - 6:00pm, Saturday  (rotating) 8:30am - 12:00pm   Responsibilities The Service Agent is responsible for the care and maintenance of the cars on the lot. This includes vacuuming and prepping the cars, shuttling cars to and from car washes and dealerships for servicing, car transports to and from offices, checking fluid levels, and changing tires.Clean vehicle exterior by hand, brush or by operating washing equipmentPolish, dry and clean vehicle windshields, windows, lights, mats and exterior body, by handVacuum, shampoo, add air freshener and clean vehicle interior (some stain removal may be required)Determine need for and add windshield fluid, gas, oil, water and antifreezePerform basic maintenance check: antenna, under the hood, inside the vehicle, inside the trunk, and outside vehicleVerify appropriate stickers are attached to vehicle (registration, plates, etc.)May be responsible for maintaining an inventory of cleaning suppliesMay assist with local automobile deliveriesPerform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned Qualifications Must be at least 18 years oldMust have 6 months work experience OR a current student at a college or universityMust have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 yearsNo drug or alcohol related conviction on driving record in the past 5 yearsMust be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.Must be willing to accept the rate of pay for this position is $9.00/hourly (non-negotiable).Must be willing to work in Milledgeville, GAApart from religious observations, must be able to work ONE of the following schedule(s):  Shift A: Monday 7:30am - 6:00pm, Wednesday 11:00am - 6:00pm, Friday 7:45am - 6:00pm, Saturday  (rotating) 8:30am - 12:00pm Shift B: Monday 7:30am - 6:00pm, Thursday 11:00am - 6:00pm, Friday 7:45am - 6:00pm, Saturday  (rotating) 8:30am - 12:00pm

JobTitle: Seasonal Overnight Vehicle Service Agent/Car Detailer
JobText: Location Portland-Airport - OR - US Description Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans Get on the fast track to a more rewarding career with Enterprise Rent A Car - We are committed to quality, innovation, customer satisfaction and employee development. We are a multibillion-dollar industry leader that is rapidly expanding and growing. At Enterprise, exciting careers and opportunities are made possible, because how far you go is really up to you. It's a fast-paced, people oriented business that offers incredible earning potential and performance-based promotions. Our philosophy is to take care of our customers and employees first. We know if we do this, success will follow - for both our company and our employees. Enterprise has an exciting opportunity for a Seasonal Full Time Overnight Vehicle Service Agent at the Portland International Airport.  The Seasonal Service Agent prepares and services vehicles prior to rental including: refueling, cleaning and washing, checking fluids and pressure levels of all vehicles. Performs all responsibilities with a focus on the needs of our customers and in accordance with our Quality Standards. This is a Seasonal Full-Time Overnight Position and candidates must be able to work the graveyard shift. Position Type: Logistics & Supply ChainBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Distribution Center - Junction CityReq ID: 2017-18289Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 3210 South US Hwy 77Overview: The equipment operator is responsible for the safe operation of all powered equipment within the Service Center.  Duties include accurately moving, stacking, and loading product as well as consolidating and staging pallets for put away.  All equipment operators must be able to certify on any machine within the warehouse as business needs dictate.The position works from Sunday-Thursday from 11:00AM-7:30PM or until work is completed. Mandatory overtime will be scheduled during busy seasons.Responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. *Safely operate all power equipment within the JCSC. Equipment includes: swing reach truck, reach truck, order picker, and any other machines as needed.*Ensure all assigned equipment is fully operational at beginning of shift which includes checking for damage and reporting all damages or malfunctions to supervisor immediately.*Operates heavy equipment of various sizes and weights used in a distribution facility.*Maneuvers equipment in and around tight corners, through staging areas, and around pedestrian traffic in a safe manner. *Performs routine inspection and preventive maintenance on assigned equipment and refers defects or needed repairs to the supervisor; cleans equipment. *Properly follows company and OSHA safety procedures. Ability to work in a fast paced environmentAbility to read, write, operate RF device, conduct business related mathematics and analyze data as required.Brings problems to the attention of the supervisor, manager, safety director or HR manager.Follows daily procedures and protocols as set forth in job orientations and trainings.All other duties as assigned*Denotes essential functionsQualifications: High School Diploma or GEDMinimum of 6 months of previous equipment operations experience highly preferred.Must work 11:00AM-7:30PM or until work is completed to include mandatory overtime.

Position Type: Logistics & Supply ChainBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Distribution Center - Junction CityReq ID: 2017-18291Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 3210 South US Hwy 77Overview: The MHI-Modules uses a radio frequency (RF) gun to locate and select merchandise for shipment to stores. MHI-Modules also performs case opening procedures to include scanning all boxes, opening cases, and then placing them on the correct conveyor for sorting.  Associates assigned to the Modules will confirm empty locations as well as assign merchandise to empty locations and create cases.This position works Sunday-Thursday 12:00PM-8:30PM with mandatory overtime as needed to include up to 12 hour work days and weekends.Responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. *Accurately use and operate an RF scanning device to locate and scan merchandise.*Ambulate to storage bins and accurately pick merchandise from storage bins, scan merchandise, and place on conveyor line for tilt tray.*Scan all incoming cases and quickly open all cases and sort them to correct conveyor.*Confirm empty locations and assign merchandise to an empty location *Create cases to be placed back into the reserve locations*Properly follows company and OSHA safety procedures. Ability to work in a fast paced environment.Ability to read, write, conduct business related mathematics and analyze data as required.Brings problems to the attention of the supervisor, manager, safety director or HR manager.Follows daily procedures and protocols as set forth in job orientations and trainings.All other duties as assigned                                                              *Denotes essential functionsQualifications: High School Diploma or GEDMinimum of 6 months of previous experience in a warehouse facility preferred.Ability to work Sunday-Thursday from 12:00PM-8:30PM as well as working up to 12 hour days and weekends.

Equipment includes: swing reach truck, reach truck, order picker, and any other machines as needed.*Ensure all assigned equipment is fully operational at beginning of shift which includes checking for damage and reporting all damages or malfunctions to supervisor immediately.*Operates heavy equipment of various sizes and weights used in a distribution facility.*Maneuvers equipment in and around tight corners, through staging areas, and around pedestrian traffic in a safe manner. *Performs routine inspection and preventive maintenance on assigned equipment and refers defects or needed repairs to the supervisor; cleans equipment. *Properly follows company and OSHA safety procedures. Ability to work in a fast paced environmentAbility to read, write, operate RF device, conduct business related mathematics and analyze data as required.Brings problems to the attention of the supervisor, manager, safety director or HR manager.Follows daily procedures and protocols as set forth in job orientations and trainings.All other duties as assigned*Denotes essential functionsQualifications: High School Diploma or GEDMinimum of 6 months of previous equipment operations experience highly preferred.Must work 2:30AM-11:00AM or until work is completed (10-12 hour days possible) to include mandatory overtime.

Position Type: Logistics & Supply ChainBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Distribution Center - Junction CityReq ID: 2017-18293Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 3210 South US Hwy 77Overview: The MHI-Tilt Tray inducts apparel and footwear onto the tilt trays and packs product sorted by the tilt trays for shipment to stores. The MHI-Tilt Tray is also responsible for ensuring boxes from induction are reused or disposed of and that boxes are created and available on the monorail system for packers.This is a 2nd shift position working Sunday-Thursday from 1:00PM-9:30PM with possible mandatory overtime during busy seasons.Responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. *Stand (stationary position) at induction station and accurately induct merchandise.*Accurately use and operate an RF scanning device to induct and pack merchandise as needed.*Monitor packing chutes and accurately pack merchandise for shipment to stores. *Evaluate boxes to determine reusability and sort boxes by size*Create new boxes and places empty boxes on monorail system for use in packing function.*Properly follows company and OSHA safety procedures.Ability to work in a fast paced environment.Ability to read, write, conduct business related mathematics and analyze data as required.Brings problems to the attention of the supervisor, manager, safety director or HR manager.Follows daily procedures and protocols as set forth in job orientations and trainings.All other duties as assigned*Denotes essential functionsQualifications: High School Diploma or GEDMinimum of 6 months of previous experience in a warehouse facility preferred.Must be able to work Sun-Thurs 1:00PM-9:30PM  and mandatory overtime as needed

Position Type: Information Systems & TechnologyBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Corporate Office - ChicagoReq ID: 2017-18302Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 219 South State St.Overview: The Senior Architect – checkout and OMS is responsible for building and maintaining detailed architecture of the core services platform supporting ecommerce functions on foot locker’s online and mobile channels. The technical architect works with the development teams to derive and implement the architecture needs addressing operational excellence. The technical architect must communicate effectively with the project/program managers to identify technical debt tasks. Works with the leadership to develop tools required for the longer term platform vision.Responsibilities: Design and build different OMS modules Order Capture, Order Processing, Order Promising & Fulfillment, Payment Processing, Reverse LogisticsDesign and build different Inventory Management modules Inventory update from fulfillment partners, Inventory Availability & ATP, Supply & Demand management, Inventory Reservation, Backorder managementHands on development on building n-tier applications using SOA, Java/J2EE, Oracle and related technologies.Manage code & configurations for multiple environments, release management process, creating and maintaining environment configuration and controls, code integrity and work closely with infrastructure and devops teams.Analyzing business requirements, story-boards and similar artifacts of the scrum process, work in an agile development environment with a quick turnaround time and iterative builds.Work in a high performance team environment - sharing innovative ideas and working collaboratively across teams.Qualifications: Strong knowledge of package software applications, software development, and integration technologies.Expert knowledge of Java (J2EE) programming languageDemonstrated technical leadership in the Order Management domain.8 + years experience programming in Java/J2EE, JSP, Servlet, EJB, XML/ JASON, XSLT, XSD, JMS, WSDL, WADL and related technologies.3 + years experience with RDBMS (Oracle), SQL and Web-Services (SOAP/REST).Experience with source control tool experience (GIT, Subversion) and build tools (Ant, Maven).Experience configuring & deploying applications on jBoss application server (Apache Tomcat, WebLogic, WebSphere will be a plus).Experience with Perl and/or UNIX shell scripting will be preferred.Experience in building/implementing high performance & a scalable system is a plus.Knowledge of standard tools for optimizing and testing code.Ability to operate effectively and independently in a dynamic, fluid environment.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or closely related field and 10 years of related work experience.Experience working on cross functional teams and managing time independently with little direction.

Position Type: Information Systems & TechnologyBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Corporate Office - ChicagoReq ID: 2017-18303Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 219 South State St.Overview: Foot Locker, Inc. is seeking a Senior Software Engineer-core services, to be part of implementing scalable, highly available, and secure Restful API used by our website, native apps, and partners consuming internal and external services in a microservices cloud environment. The ideal candidate has a passion for delivering simple, robust solutions to solve business problems through development of high quality code. Position Type: Information Systems & TechnologyBrand: Foot Locker, Inc.Location Name: Corporate Office - WausauReq ID: 2017-18307Job Type: Regular Full-TimeLocation: 111 South 1st AvenueOverview: Foot Locker, Inc. is the world's leading retailer of athletically inspired shoes and apparel. Headquartered in New York City, it operates approximately 3,500 athletic retail stores in 21 countries in North America, Europe and Australia under the brand names Foot Locker, Lady Foot Locker, Kids Foot Locker, Footaction, and Champs Sports.Additionally, the Company's Footlocker.com business operates a direct-to-customer business offering athletic footwear, apparel and equipment through its Internet and catalog channels. Provide guidance to team on use and interpretationCommunicate clearly and effectively with business users and agile teams through all phases of the development life cycleDeliver key findings to members of the business though presentations and direct engagement that result in actions and improved decision making Develop and perform value measurement and tests to refine approaches and influence direction of analytic product developmentResearch and troubleshoot problems & questions related to deployed analytic solutionsMaintain knowledge on the latest data technology and best practicesPerform other related duties as assigned.Qualifications: Proficient in SQL and structured databases; familiarity with unstructured big data analysisKnowledge of analytical tools R or Python Basic Knowledge of advanced statistics, data manipulation, and research methods preferredExperienced in BI data visualization tools (e.g. Microstrategy, Tableau)Must be able to think both creatively and criticallyMust demonstrate the ability to interpret business data and translate into insightful recommendationsMust be highly motivated and be able to work both independently and in a team environmentExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsStrong organizational and interpersonal skillsRequires a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Finance, Operations Research, Applied Math, Computer Science or related quantitative field from an accredited university or collegeExperience working on cross functional teams, multitasking and managing time independently with little direction.

JobTitle: Senior Merchandise Manager - Old Navy - Oklahoma City F/S (New Store)
JobText: Old Navy makes current American fashion essentials accessible to every family. From day one, Old Navy was a revolution. We were something the world had never seen - fabulous, affordable fashion. We didn't take ourselves too seriously, and we broke the industry's rules. What we believe in today is exactly what we believed in when we started: we’re on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find their must-have fashion essentials online as well as in one of our 1,000+ stores located globally.As part of the Field organization, you make the brand come to life for our customers. Our stores are fast paced, fun, diverse and full of passionate people who love fashion. The Field offers endless opportunities to grow your career and be a leader – of your peers, of teams, of a business, and in the community.Old Navy – a brand for everyone, a place for you!Job Summary:As the Senior Merchandise Manager, you drive profitable sales growth by planning and executing company merchandising direction through standard operating procedure execution in your department (i.e. markdowns, signage, replenishment and marketing). You lead a department responsible for a majority of the total store sales and play a pivotal role in leading a complex and dynamic business. As the subject matter expert for all brand merchandising training, tools and resources, you train, coach and hold others accountable to brand merchandising and productivity standards. Your department consistently represents brand standards and company strategies. To drive profitability, you are responsible for flexing based on our brand’s merchandising principles and financial analysis. You know and execute all company product knowledge and strategy. You own the development of your direct reports, and create a culture of engagement and high performance through development and coaching Brand Associates, Department Managers and Specialists. As a senior leader in the building, you are expected to lead the leadership team in the absence of your General Manager.As an Old Navy leader, your first priority is to contribute to the success of your store. This means that you not only deliver in your role as the Senior Merchandise Manager, but you also model leadership behaviors and deliver as a manager on duty. As the Manager on Duty, you deliver results during your assigned time, drive key performance indicators and brand loyalty by leading through your team. You make decisions and collaborate with other members of your store leadership team to prioritize work based on business needs and company direction.Key Competencies:PlanningDeveloping Direct Reports and OthersLearning AgilityDecision QualityBusiness AcumenDrive for ResultsProcess ManagementNote: This position description indicates the general nature and levels of work, knowledge, skills, abilities and other essential functions expected for the aforementioned position. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required.Qualifications:Must be at least 18 years of ageCollege degree or equivalent work experience preferred2-3 years of soft lines and visual merchandising experience preferredAbility to effectively communicate with customers and employeesAbility to maneuver around sales floor, stock room, work with and around cleaning chemicals, and lift/carry up to 50 lbs.Ability to work a flexible schedule (including travel) to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, overnight and weekend shifts
JobLocation: 7638 W RENO AVENUE, , Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, , 73127

JobTitle: Supervisor - Banana Republic - Kierland Commons - Scottsdale
JobText: Who We AreBanana Republic Brand Ambassador: We are team players who are engaging, sociable, team oriented and stylish. We are passionate about fashion and trend and always do what is right for our customers. We create a customer centric environment and are relentless about exceeding goals. We are curious, honest and kind; we bring joy to everyone.Engaging: We are inviting, easily connecting with others. We are passionate, approachable and in service to our customers. We recognize others successes. Sociable: We actively seek new experiences, information, and knowledge. We proactively solicit feedback from our internal and external customers, responding quickly to feedback. We are digitally connected and socially conscious. Team Oriented: We work together to achieve our goals. We are supportive, respectful and caring. We remain resilient in difficult situations. Stylish: We are enthusiastic and knowledgeable about product and trend. Our style is relevant and chic.What We DoPrimary Responsibilities:As a member of the Banana Republic field leadership team, the Supervisor is responsible for supporting the GM, Associate Manager, and Assistant Manager in managing all aspects of their store’s business, including training Brand Ambassadors; executing store strategy; achieving key business goals and delivering an exceptional store experience. The Supervisor participates in the DOR rotations of Operations, Product and Talent.Business Results: Contributes to driving the productivity of the team to achieve store financial, revenue and expense targets. Monitors sales to ensure labor is utilized to optimize traffic and sales generation. Works closely with leadership team to measure the success of brand initiatives, in-store trends and market insights to drive sales.Customer Centric: Supports the team in executing operational excellence by leveraging a customer centric mindset. Helps establish effective relationships to build brand loyalty.Ambassador: Represents the brand and understands the competition. Upholds a high quality store experience for both the internal and external customer. Contributes to store involvement in community programs. Supports building effective cross brand and store center relationships.Inspiration: Energizes the team to achieve results. Performs leader on duty responsibilities and other duties as assigned. Supports team performance through Growth Mindset. Communicates priorities to Brand Ambassadors; redirects activities as needed to achieve productivity standards.Compliance: Holds self and team accountable to all Gap Inc. standards of performance. Supports efforts to reduce instore shrink activity through education, awareness and compliance. Ensures compliance to all Federal, Provincial, State and Gap Inc. employment requirements.Key Qualifications:6 months Gap experienceCustomer focusedDemonstrated ability to deliver resultsBasic business acumen skillsEstablished time management skillsStrong planning and prioritization skillsCommunicates effectivelyTech savvyRequirements:College degree preferredAbility to maneuver around sales floor, stockroom and officeTravel between stores and outside the state/province, if necessaryOpen availability to meet the needs of the business, including evenings and weekends

JobTitle: General Manager - Banana Republic Factory Store - Tucson Premium
JobText: Who We AreBanana Republic Brand Ambassador: We are team players who are engaging, sociable, team oriented and stylish. We are passionate about fashion and trend and always do what is right for our customers. We create a customer centric environment and are relentless about exceeding goals. We are curious, honest and kind; we bring joy to everyone.Engaging: We are inviting, easily connecting with others. We are passionate, approachable and in service to our customers. We proactively solicit feedback from our internal and external customers, responding quickly to feedback. We are digitally connected and socially conscious. Our style is relevant and chic.What We DoPrimary Responsibilities:As a member of the Banana Republic  leadership team, the General Manager is responsible for creating the conditions for success in all aspects of the store’s business, including: sourcing, selecting and developing all team members; executing store strategy to deliver annual field priorities; and achieving key business goals. The General Manager shares the vision for the store, communicating in a way that each employee is clear on their contribution to the store’s success.Business Results: Consistently inspires team to achieve results and perform at a high level. Knows the competition and market trends to positively impact business. Drives productivity of the team. Monitors labor to maximize productivity, optimize traffic and achieve sales goals. Leads implementation of product placement, marketing and promotional strategies. Creates strategies and processes that deliver results.Customer Centric: Exceeds the expectations of internal and external customers. Establishes effective relationships to build brand loyalty. Fosters a healthy and productive environment where employees can maximize their potential. Ensures the team executes operational excellence through a customer centric mindset.Ambassador: Represents the brand, understands the competitors and drives excellent tenant and community relationships. Promotes store involvement with our Community in Action programs. Upholds high quality store experiences for the internal and external customer. JobText: About ARO Innovation Center of Excellence:We are a community of inquisitive, collaborative and consciousness explorers who seek to fully understand and solve customer performance and environmental challenges.  We bring together knowledge, wisdom and expertise to create an innovation ecosystem to address these challenges, ultimately turning problems into commercial opportunities and creating a meaningful, positive impact on our customers’ lives, the planet, our brands and the business.Job Description Summary:The senior manager of innovation strategy and operations will enable the agile and fast-paced innovation center of excellence, a highly technical interdisciplinary group of forward-thinking scientists, engineers, designers, sourcing professionals and outside research institutions, to bring product innovations to life across all brands within the Gap, Inc. portfolio. Manage company-wide innovation portfolio across all brands, including providing visibility to all projects within global sourcing organizationPrepare cost benefit analysis of company-wide innovation platforms and projectsWork with consumer insights to develop Gap Inc.’s SWOT analysis and competitive landscape focusing on portfolio innovation strategyInterface with brand leadership and strategy teams to understand and align innovation CoE’s strategies and product platforms  Support operations and innovation leaders to evaluate investment deals with technology, vendor, and other start-up partnerships; work with corporate development team to create joint-development business agreementsDrive project work streams to identify and evaluate critical strategic growth opportunities and priorities across product categoriesWork with tiger team leaders to develop and validate innovation project roadmaps, milestones, and go / no go decision mapping Identify and create KPIs against plans and establish scorecard tools and processes to outline progressStructure and prepare reporting for senior company leadership meetingsQualifications:Strong passion for working in innovation and apparel industry; retail/apparel or retail management consulting a plus 5+ years of work experience in Strategic Planning, Product Management, Business Development, Management Consulting or a related fieldProven ability to provide insightful data analysis & synthesis that unlocks consumer and market opportunitiesProven ability to lead cross-functional teams and own multiple projects at onceStrong problem solving skills, including qualitative and quantitative methodologiesStrong interpersonal and communication skills; experience managing complex stakeholdersProven success in ambiguous environmentsStrong project management and financial modeling experienceDemand forecasting experienceInternational business experienceAdvanced power point and excel skillsMBA preferred

JobTitle: Assistant Manager - Banana Republic Factory Store - Woodburn Comp Strs
JobText: Who We AreBanana Republic Brand Ambassador: We are team players who are engaging, sociable, team oriented and stylish. We are passionate about fashion and trend and always do what is right for our customers. We create a customer centric environment and are relentless about exceeding goals. We are curious, honest and kind; we bring joy to everyone.Engaging: We are inviting, easily connecting with others. We are passionate, approachable and in service to our customers. We recognize others successes. Sociable: We actively seek new experiences, information, and knowledge. We proactively solicit feedback from our internal and external customers, responding quickly to feedback. We are digitally connected and socially conscious. Team Oriented: We work together to achieve our goals. We are supportive, respectful and caring. We remain resilient in difficult situations. Stylish: We are enthusiastic and knowledgeable about product and trend. Our style is relevant and chic.What We DoPrimary Responsibilities:As a member of the Banana Republic field leadership team, the Assistant Manager is responsible for supporting the GM and/ or Associate Manager in creating the conditions for success in all aspects of their store’s business, including sourcing and training all Brand Ambassadors; executing store strategy to deliver annual field priorities, and creating a compelling customer centric experience. The Assistant Manager supports the GM and Associate Manager in sharing the vision for the store, communicating in a way that each employee is aware of their contribution to the store’s success. Additionally, the Assistant Manager is responsible for leading a rotating Division of Responsibility (Product, Talent and Operations) while achieving key business goals.Business Results: Supports the inspiration of the team to achieve results and perform at a high level. Is knowledgeable about the competition and market trends to positively impact business. Drives productivity of the team. Monitors labor to maximize productivity, optimize traffic and achieve sales goals. Contributes to the implementation of product placement, marketing and promotional strategies. Supports strategies and processes that deliver results.Customer Centric: Exceeds the expectations of internal and external customers. Establishes effective relationships to build brand loyalty. Fosters a healthy and productive environment where employees can maximize their potential. Ensures the team executes operational excellence through a customer centric mindset.Ambassador: Represents the brand, understands the competitors and supports excellent tenant and community relationships. Promotes store involvement with our Community in Action programs. Upholds high quality store experiences for the internal and external customer. Supports effective cross brand and store center partnerships.Builds Highly Productive Teams: Sources, selects and develops high potential talent, effectively assessing for skill and cultural fit. Accountable for team performance through, coaching and feedback. Teaches and trains Brand Ambassadors to build skill.Passionate: Knowledgeable and passionate about Banana Republic, our customer and our product.Accountable: Holds team and self-accountable to all Gap Inc. standards of performance. Supports efforts to reduce in store shrink activity through education and awareness. Ensures compliance to all Federal, Provincial, State and Gap Inc. employment requirements.Key Qualifications:1-3 years of retail management experienceCustomer focusedDemonstrated ability to deliver resultsBasic business acumen skillsPlanning and prioritization skillsCommunicates effectivelyTech savvyRequirements:College Degree preferredAbility to lift up to 30 poundsAbility to maneuver around sales floor, stockroom and officeTravel between stores and outside the state/province, if necessaryOpen availability to meet the needs of the business, including evenings and weekends

JobTitle: Department Specialist - Old Navy - Landing @ Tradition
JobText: Old Navy makes current American fashion essentials accessible to every family. From day one, Old Navy was a revolution. We were something the world had never seen - fabulous, affordable fashion. We didn't take ourselves too seriously, and we broke the industry's rules. What we believe in today is exactly what we believed in when we started: we’re on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find their must-have fashion essentials online as well as in one of our 1,000+ stores located globally.As part of the Field organization, you make the brand come to life for our customers. Our stores are fast paced, fun, diverse and full of passionate people who love fashion. The Field offers endless opportunities to grow your career and be a leader – of your peers, of teams, of a business, and in the community.Old Navy – a brand for everyone, a place for you!Job Summary:As the Department Specialist, you drive profitable sales growth by planning and executing company merchandising direction in your assigned department to drive sales and deliver standard operating procedure execution (i.e. markdowns, signage, replenishment, marketing). As the subject matter expert for all brand merchandising training, product standard operating procedures, tools and resources, you are also responsible for ensuring Brand Associates are trained and meet merchandising standards and productivity expectations. Your department consistently represents brand standards and company strategies. You are responsible for flexing to drive profitability based on our brand’s merchandising principles and financial analysis.As an Old Navy leader, your first priority is to contribute to the success of your store. This means that you not only deliver in your role as the Department Specialist, but you also model leadership behaviors and deliver as a manager on duty. As the Manager on Duty, you deliver results during your assigned time, drive key performance indicators and brand loyalty by leading through your team. You make decisions and collaborate with other members of your store leadership team to prioritize work based on business needs and company direction.Key Competencies:PlanningFunctional and Technical SkillsLearning AgilityDecision QualityBusiness AcumenInformingNote: This position description indicates the general nature and levels of work, knowledge, skills, abilities and other essential functions expected for the aforementioned position. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required.Qualifications:Must be at least 18 years of ageCollege degree or equivalent work experience preferred2-3  years of soft lines and visual merchandising  experience preferredAbility to effectively communicate with customers and employeesAbility to maneuver around sales floor, stock room, work with and around cleaning chemicals, and lift/carry up to 50 lbs.Ability to work a flexible schedule (including travel) to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, overnight and weekend shifts
JobLocation: 10880 SW VILLAGE PARKWAY, , Port Saint Lucie, Florida, , 34986
