Job Description - Assurance Services Manager - External Audit (ATL003H1)Job Description Assurance Services Manager - External Audit - ATL003H1US-GA-Atlanta.   From small businesses to some of the world’s best-known brands, our clients count on reliable financial statements, information and processes to form their ongoing strategies. More than ever, business is about interpreting and reacting to complex data - and they look to us for advice and services they can trust every time. You will use your professional skills and experience to make it happen, assisting our client to address the accounting and financial reporting challenges facing its business.   The opportunity   You’ll help our clients meet their reporting requirements by accurately reporting on financial statements and providing meaningful insights into accounting and reporting matters. In return, you can expect leading-class learning and development tailored to your unique interests and motivations. You’ll be given all the skills, knowledge and opportunities to progress and become ready to build a better working world for our people, our clients and the communities that support us.   Your key responsibilities   Everything you’ll do will come back to providing exceptional audit activities for our clients. Colleagues and clients from a diverse array of backgrounds will look to you first for answers, so you’ll be a high-profile contact when it comes to resolving complex issues. As you build your knowledge and experience, you’ll become a credible advisor, influencing clients and engagement teams on resolutions that will impact entire industries.   Skills and attributes for success Leading fieldwork, managing performance and keeping engagement leaders updated on audit engagements Completing audit processes and documenting higher-risk areas to increase your technical and business skills in areas including revenue, financial instruments and income taxes Engaging clients and providing authoritative advice and professionalism throughout transactions Constantly developing your understanding of current market trends and processes and sharing your knowledge to develop junior colleagues Understanding our clients’ unique ambitions and needs and referring them to colleagues in other teams and areas to broaden our business relationships where possible To qualify for the role you must have A bachelor’s degree in an accounting, finance or business discipline, supported by 5 to 8 years’ work experience as an auditor in a public accounting firm US CPA licensure in your work state Experience leading the planning, execution and reporting on audits of financial statements applying US GAAP Proven project management skills Excellent communication and negotiation skills and a collaborative approach to management The flexibility to constantly learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment Ideally you’ll have Experience with SEC clients using SOX 404 and applying PCAOB standards What we look for   We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you’re serious about auditing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers   We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 21 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer: Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.    EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

JobTitle: Advisory Services Manager - Financial Services - Performance Improvement - Insurance Operations - Underwriting
JobText: Job Description - Advisory Services Manager - Financial Services - Performance Improvement - Insurance Operations - Underwriting (NEW00IBN)Job Description Advisory Services Manager - Financial Services - Performance Improvement - Insurance Operations - Underwriting - NEW00IBNUS-NY-New YorkIn a world where sustaining performance has never been more important, our clients look to us for answers. As an Underwriting Insurance Manager, within the Financial Services Office (FSO) you’ll embody our Performance Improvement (PI) services, helping our clients grow and translate their strategy into reality.  It’s a highly varied area, so whether you’re interested in underwriting, product, policy or billing you’ll always have an opportunity to work on something new while building from your past experiences. The opportunity You will be a part of EY’s purpose of building a better working world, teaming with other FSO professionals and our clients to solve the most complex challenges.  Whether developing a target operating model, defining he Property and Casualty insurance product architecture, defining the future state capability maturity, or creating  functional requirements, all of our services are provided through our service line delivery methodology.  We have the opportunity to provide exceptional client service in every client encounter by bringing the full suite of permitted services to our client responsively.  By using relevant service line, area and sector insights, account teams can convert more opportunities into EY engagements and continue winning in the market.   Your key responsibilities You’re likely to spend most of your time on operational aspects of client business. That means developing an in-depth understanding of our clients’ unique needs and goals, before developing meaningful improvement insights. You’ll also need to communicate effective new strategies with your team. You may be also involved in developing enablement plans and in their subsequent delivery to bring the strategies to life. Since you’ll regularly be onsite with our clients, a significant amount of out-of-town travel will be involved in this role.   Skills and attributes for success ·         Collaborating, leading, mentoring and coaching team members and delegating relevant responsibilities to Performance Improvement team colleagues ·         Building strong external relationships and promoting business opportunities to other areas of the business ·         Anticipating our clients’ needs and provide compelling strategic insights by constantly updating and sharing your consumer industry knowledge on the latest trends and leading practices ·         Great communication and influencing skills ·         Responding to complex issues in a wide range of subjects including consolidation, margin pressure, rising commodity prices, new regulations, global competition and breaking into new markets             To qualify for the role you must have A bachelor's degree and approximately 5 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and approximately 4 years of related work experience A minimum of 3 years of experience working in Property and Casualty (P&C) underwriting commercial lines or specialty lines are preferred; Consulting experience preferred Demonstrated ability to manage and supervise teams of business advisors through all phases of the project lifecycle, including requirements definition, process and prose creation, business re-engineering, application mapping Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, presentation, client service and business writing and consulting skills, coupled with a strong interest in further designing, developing and integrating business operations and technology Ability to research client inquiries and emerging issues, including regulations, property and casualty insurance industry practices, and new application technologies A valid driver's license in the US and a valid passport required; willingness and ability to travel internationally   Ideally, you’ll also have Experience with the following vendor products: FirstBest, Adaptik PolicyWriter, Accenture DuckCreek, Guidewire Policy, Pegasystems  What we look for If you’re a natural leader, with a talent for answering and communicating complex client problems, we’re interested in you. You’ll need to be great at influencing people, ready to listen and confident in challenging the status quo. If you’ve a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve their full potential, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business.   About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. ·         Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry ·         Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career ·         The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Build your legacy with us. Apply today.

If you’re serious about auditing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers   We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 15 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer: Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.    EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

Job Description - Part Time Nabisco Merchandiser-Warwick, RI (1707252)Job Description Part Time Nabisco Merchandiser-Warwick, RI(Job Number: 1707252)Description Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world.  Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.   Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.   Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do. For more information, visit www.mondelezinternational.com and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational.     Primary Role:The role of the Mondelēz International Sales Service Representative (Merchandiser) is to build a world-class Direct Store Delivery (DSD) business at the retail level by fulfilling the merchandising needs of our grocery-related customers. As a Merchandiser for our company you are primarily, though not exclusively, merchandising Nabisco specific brands. Areas of focus will include full-shelf conditions, neatly-merchandised displays and shelves, building display point-of-sale in all areas of the store, properly-rotated product on the shelf, and accurate price tags / point-of-sale in all departments. A major objective of this role is to establish and maintain rapport with key store individuals, while providing outstanding customer service. This role will be responsible for maintaining a timely and accurate merchandising call schedule. This role will also be responsible for identifying and communicating individual store opportunities to the appropriate Mondelēz International personnel.Mondelēz International is an employer of inclusion who partners with diversity groups which cater to people of all ethnicities, genders, ages and sexual orientations. Mondelēz International also works with military veterans to help hire our heroes who have served our nation, as well as partner with disability networks to include people of all abilities to help the company succeed for years to come.Benefits and Compensation:The PART-TIME Sales Service Representative position offers a competitive hourly compensation rate, work related mileage reimbursement and an Employee Assistance Program.Qualifications Key Competencies: Ability to perform hard work in a fast-pace work environment and meet the defined physical activities (frequent lifting, bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing, pulling, etc.) while adhering to the safety expectations and processes Planning and organizing skills Effective communication skills Creativity Flexibility Detail-oriented Problem solving skills Computer literate (Microsoft Office, Internet and Cellular/Wireless devices)Requirements: You must be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license, reliable transportation, proof of auto insurance and have access to the internet with a personal email account. A flexible work schedule is required, including being available to work weekends and holidays. Previous retail / grocery experience a plus. Successful completion of drug test, MVR check, and general background check.  Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.Applicants must complete all required steps in the application process, including providing education and work history, in order to be considered for this position. All applicants will receive an email after submitting the first stage of the application. This email will include a link to return to the second stage of the application process. If you had previously submitted a resume, you will need to confirm/verify education and work history. For those that did not submit a resume, you will need to manually enter education and work history.Primary Location: NA-US-Rhode Island-WarwickJob: Field SalesSchedule: Part-time

JobTitle: director of food quality assurance, Research and Development - Seattle, WA
JobText: Job Description - director of food quality assurance, Research and Development - Seattle, WA (160015932)Job Description director of food quality assurance, Research and Development - Seattle, WA (Job Number: 160015932) Location: US-WA-Seattle Starbucks - Quality Assurance and Food Safety      Now Brewing –  director of QA, food, research and development!   From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for hiring talent who share this passion and are guided by their service to others.   “We built the Starbucks brand first with our people, not with consumers. Because we believed the best way to meet and exceed expectations of our customers was to hire and train great people, we invest in employees.” Howard Schultz, CEO, Starbucks Coffee Company     As a director of QA, food, you will contribute to Starbucks success by leading the development of a vision for quality at Starbucks. You’ll coordinate the development, implementation and monitoring of the systems and tools required to deliver this vision with a focus on effective management of product safety risk and consistent delivery of the Starbucks experience through all channels through Starbucks guiding principles.    The food program is considered to be one of the most important strategies that Starbucks believes is needed to deliver upon corporate growth expectations. The director of quality assurance – food will be expected to be integral role in working collaboratively across the organization to ensure food safety is continuously improved upon, the Starbucks customer is seen as central to decisions and suppliers are developed to our high standards. We plan to double our sales in food within the next five years.   Leveraging your previous experience, we will enable you to use your strengths in: Leadership - Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together:  Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results.  Supports the implementation of Company programs, procedures, methods and practices to promote Starbucks key messages and achieve a competitive advantage.  Planning and Execution - Developing strategic and operational plans for the work group, managing execution, and measuring results:  Contributes to the development of long-term strategies and plans for the business unit/department.  Plans and manages business unit and department processes and practices to ensure that programs are aligned with company business goals and objectives.  Prepares, communicates and educates client groups and team on changes in policies and practices within the organization.  Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities:  Assures compliance to quality and product safety standards from source of supply to consumer.  Develops an integrated quality assurance program and budget covering beverage, food, merchandise, product distribution channels and retail facilities.  Implements and manages the product safety and quality assurance program to ensure that product safety, quality and regulatory compliance standards are met for all beverage, food and merchandise items manufactured and sold in Starbucks retail stores.  Manages quality assurance projects and supervises partners.  Monitors the effectiveness and compliance of an ongoing training program on safe food handling and sanitation practices.  Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams:  Challenges and inspires partners to achieve business results.  Conducts and ensures the completion of performance reviews.  Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements.  Oversees training and development of partners directly and indirectly managed and makes effective staffing decisions.  Provides coaching, direction and leadership support to team members in order to achieve partner, business and customer results. We’d love to hear from people with: Progressive experience managing a research and development or quality assurance department    Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

JobTitle: associate production manager, Rollstock & Packaging, Global Sourcing Supply Development- Seattle, WA
JobText: Job Description - associate production manager, Rollstock & Packaging, Global Sourcing Supply Development- Seattle, WA (170021128)Job Description associate production manager, Rollstock & Packaging, Global Sourcing Supply Development- Seattle, WA (Job Number: 170021128) Location: US-WA-Seattle-Starbucks Support Center Starbucks - Supply Chain Management Job Summary and Mission   This position contributes to Starbucks success by This position contributes to Starbucks success by executing print production, creative concept design and project management services to support Global Creative Services and Business Unit deliverables. Responsible for all facets of print production management from concept development to production ensuring best value, high quality and timely delivery. Collaborates effectively internally and with suppliers. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks Guiding Principles.   Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.   Summary of Key Responsibilities   Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:   Print Production Execute against color management guidelines across multiple projects and substrates. Provides technical expertise in the areas of offset, web, rotogravure, flexographic, digital, screen printing, finishing requirements and printing innovation. Develop and Leverage Industry and Supplier Knowledge Knowledge of key industry players, competitors and market dynamics. Leverages effective business and professional relationships with strategic suppliers and industry players Possess industry knowledge. Has an understanding of primary supply chain principals. Manage Complex Cross-Functional Projects Executes project plans that define scope, schedule, budget, business impacts and risks. Effectively uses program and project management tools and techniques. Solves problems and makes recommendations for primary and strategic execution and tactical issues within the relevant portfolio of projects and or processes. Provides day to day oversight and performs a hands on execution role Leadership and Teamwork Able to motivate and collaborate within their team and across their peer group. Lead using demonstrated and proven experience and the application of best practice project management skills. Works within peer group and leadership infrastructure to ensure that best practice and leverage opportunities are delivered.Summary of Experience Print production (3-5 years) Color management (3-5 years) Pre-press (3-5 years) Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Strong analytical skills Knowledge of design and development processes. Creative problem solving skills Ability to influence at an Executive Level both internally and externally. Ability to lead and influence peer groups both internally and externally Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Knowledge of Excel, Oracle, MS Office, Word, Powerpoint   Starbucks is an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

JobTitle: Dual studies 2018: Bachelor of Arts (w/m) - Business Administration
Dual studies 2018: Bachelor of Engineering – Production or design technology(m/f)

JobText: Lockheed Martin is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer Associate for a position in Ocala, FL. Duties include: Utilize basic drafting and software programs to develop MPP's, design tooling, support equipment, process flows. Provide technical guidance and support to manufacturing operators to facilitate assembly performance. Apply lean manufacturing techniques to reduce cost and increase yields. Investigate root cause of failures/defects and implement corrective action to support continuous improvement. Lockheed Martin is seeking a Reliability Engineer for a position in Orlando, FL to provide support to the Apache Program. Main roles includes: Ability and willingness to learn Built-In-Test (BIT) design. Execution of FRACAS and Monitoring of trends to identify System BIT improvements. Analysis of wire-code (WC) procedures. Develop, coordinate and conduct technical reliability studies & evaluations of engineering design. Compile and analyze performance reports and process control statistics; investigate and analyze relevant variables potentially affecting product and processes and as necessary, proposes changes in design or formulation to improve system and/or process reliability. JobTitle: Associate Structures/Dynamics Flight Test Engineer, Pax River
JobText: Plan, conduct and report on helicopter flight tests with respect to structures and dynamics. Our responsibilities include initial envelope expansion and development tests, flight loads/strain and vibration surveys, dynamic stability tests and structural oversight of tests performed by other disciplines. Test planning function involves determining measurement and flight condition requirements necessary to safely provide evaluation, qualification and certification data. These details are written into published test plans. Test conduct involves briefing flight and ground crews and providing real-time telemetry monitoring of critical parameters. Large volumes of gathered flight test data are processed and analyzed to support development and/or certification/qualification. Test results, conclusions and recommendations are published in reports.Basic Qualificationspan>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or Aeronautical Engineering degree or related discipline from an accredited college.Minimum 3.0 GPADesired skillspan>Knowledge of aircraft or automotive structures and/or dynamics. Key skills and knowledge required are:• Analytical thinking and problem solving• Communication (both written and oral)• Technical writing• Computer skills (Microsoft Office, Matlab, VBA)• Experience in aerospace, test engineering, rotary wing design and airplane or helicopter piloting considered a plus. Note: This position involves significant teamwork and coordination with flight test co-workers in a variety of disciplines (pilots, mechanics, inspectors, instrumentation and data technicians), qualification or certification authority representatives, and subject matter expert design/test engineers. Good interpersonal skills are imperative. Personal flexibility is required to support unusual working hours and travel to conduct off-site testing.Additional Information:- Must currently have or be capable of successfully completing an NCIC criminal background check to access Pax NAS.- Must have a valid photo ID (driver's license + social security card or birth certificate OR US passport).- Must have valid driver's license/vehicle insurance to drive on base at Pax NAS.This position will be primarily located in Patuxent River, MD and is dependent upon the anticipated duration of the CH-53K helicopter test program, which is currently planned to start Q2 2017* and end in Q3 2019. The employee will initially begin this assignment working at the Development Flight Center in Jupiter, FL until approximately Q2 2017 when the program transitions to Patuxent River. At the conclusion of the CH-53K helicopter test program, the employee may be offered the opportunity to relocate to the Development Flight Center to support future flight test programs, pending business conditions. *Based on current test plan scheduleAs a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

JobTitle: Associate Director, Solutions Delivery - Project/Program Manager
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description A Solutions Delivery Associate Director will monitor the product/program/project across various initiatives in the S&P Global Ratings division. They will design, develop and manage activities for solution delivery project initiatives which represent an incremental increase in value to the business but are in line with existing business processes and operations. This would include business case, solution definition and planning through build, test and deployment to production and end of life. Serves as the central resource with design, process, manufacturing, test and quality as an IT Solution moves to production, user adoption and value realization. A Solutions Delivery Associate Director will have above average skills matrix scores which they would look to develop to advance within the role, they will be advanced or expert in 25% of the core skills and be capable of coaching SD Analysts to improve their skills matrix scores in a quantifiable way. Key Roles & Responsibilities: Define project KPI's to track business value commitments defined during project initiation. Provide direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensure recommendations are aligned with customer needs and capabilities. Utilize standard procedures and policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results through IT solution delivery. Lead staff through the definition of IT solution that meets project targets measured by KPI's. Develop, define and execute project plans, schedules, budgets and deliverables. Review and analyse complex, integrated project data and information to provide status updates, insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. Sign off on IT solutions to business problems. Including non-functional requirements. Act as the conduit and escalation between App Engineering and Business Stakeholders. Present documentation to process, controls and ratings governance committees. Functional and Business Knowledge: Operate as the conduit between business stakeholders and the various IT groups (App Dev, QA, Architecture) Project Management skills Think of the problem we are trying to solve, come up with a solution and identify the implementation timelines Process Map the current and future state process, get agreement with the stakeholders before building a solution Partner with key stakeholders to provide transparency into the project Own the business process and ensure enhancements, incidents are managed in a proactive and timeline manner Experience with CRA3, Dodd Frank regulations and working with regulatory bodies like ESMA, SEC is preferred Typical Scope & Impact Contribute to the achievement of Project Management and IT objectives. Work on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. Minimum and Preferred Education Bachelor's degree; Master's preferred Minimum and Preferred Experience/Skills 8+ years of related experience, including some managerial experience Experience with CRA3 regulations and working with regulatory bodies like ESMA, SEC preferred. Experience with Agile delivery is also preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : The Role: As a HADOOP Administrator you will Support, Administer, Manage, and Tune the sub-Terra byte Data Systems that will enable S&P Global Market Intelligence to ingest, manage, process and serve-up Market Data Products (Global Risk Solutions, Pricing, Ratings & Financial Aggregates) as well as our highly transactional and dynamic web based CIQ Platform & Credit Solutions Portal. You will lead large-scale Hadoop cluster environments, handling all Hadoop environment builds, including design, cluster setup, performance tuning, ongoing monitoring and capacity planning. Do you love working every single day collaborating with the global team in ensuring reliability and supportability of the HDFS Clusters and other Open Source Software such as SOLR/Cassandra? Are you passionate about leading key database releases for QA, Alpha, Production and DR as part of the overall SDLC? In this role you will maintain the Software by patch applications and enhancements/upgrades of environments. Automate routine maintenance tasks using standard scripting practices Work with other teams with in operations and peer groups like Development and QA. Work with IT Service Management and other groups and make sure that all events, incidents and problems are resolved as per the SLA. Contribute to best of breed product support tools including run books, monitoring, and knowledge bases to aid in the product support process. Suggest improvements to current processes and tools we use and also suggest implementation ideas. The Scope & Impact: Our Platform products rely on data to allow our customers to find the companies, securities and markets they are passionate about, to explore the relationships between entities, and to search using public identifiers (CUSIPs, ISINs, SEDOLs, Tickers, etc). This critical backend driven data allow our users to value their portfolios, monitor market moving events, understand their risk and maintain their back office systems. Contribute to the achievement of Hadoop Administration objectives Work on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. The Career Opportunity: This is the place to hone your existing HDFS and leadership skills while having the chance to become exposed to divergent technologies (Oracle in RAC environments, Golden Gate Replication, Exadata, Dataguard, ZDS Appliances, WebLogic, Sonic JMS, MySQL, Informatica, MS SQL Server Product Family, NoSQL, SOLR, Vertica, Cassandra, active-active Databases, and petabyte storage levels). As a critical member of the team, you will have the opportunity collaborate with a global team of database administrators and engineers who have recently graduated as well as other team members who are authorities in their domain. Handle Production Database Support rotation on a need basis in weekends. The Team / The Business: You will be part of a premier IT Services and Operations team supporting various product offerings of S&P Global Market Intelligence powered by various middle tier, database and OS technologies and used by tens of thousands of users globally. The team is responsible for ensuring Greater Reliability, High Performance, High Availability and Scalability. You will work with a group of intelligent and visionary professionals recruited from top industries. You and your team will provide the database support, administration, scalability, performance tuning, release and architecture of large-scale data processing, aggregation and retrieval systems. Your Skills: Good hands on experience in Linux Environments Extensive Experience with HDFS (Hortonworks is preferred) and its associated technologies like Spark, HIVE, Yarn, Kafka is required. Experience with additional open Source tools like SOLR, Cassandra, Vertica and PostgreSQL is a huge advantage Good experience with Operations, administration, performance tuning, and database monitoring. Good knowledge on Shell Programming, Python, Perl Scripting, JSON or any other scripting or program language is a requirement. Superb communication skills, with strong verbal and writing proficiencies. Ability to solve problems involving Client Libraries (like JDBC), Web Logic, Operating Systems, Network and Storage is preferred. Additional Note / Our Hiring Manager says: We are looking for the kind of person who is not only a roll up the sleeves devoted Hadoop Administrator, but also a passionate team member who can lead by example and motivate their peers to excel. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering 3+ years of hands-on database administration, support and performance tuning experience Experience in a start-up or Agile or Dev Ops environment is a plus. ITIL V3 Foundation Certified - preferred About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit, S&P Global Market Intelligence To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. JobTitle: Director of Salesforce Operational Strategy (S&P Global Platts)
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: The Director, Salesforce Operational Strategy, will lead all aspects of operations and platform effectiveness from the Platts business perspective of the Salesforce.com Platform and mobile applications. Ensure delivery of innovative, high quality solutions that enable Platts cross functional Operations to accomplish business objectives. This requires the ability to understand development workflow and support applications using Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Communities, SF Mobile, Lightening and the Force.com platform. Responsibilities include translating business needs into functional requirements with detailed technical design specifications, conduct research, technical analysis, design, development, testing and implementation for Salesforce projects and enhancements based on industry best practices. Manage platform operations to facilitate continuous improvement of the Salesforce.com environment. This role will be responsible for developing operational efficiencies through technical solutions addressed by Business Stakeholders that will impact Franchise Operational Excellence. Reporting to the Global Head of Customer Excellence, the successful candidate will have a robust understanding of the Salesforce.com platform with strong people leadership skills as well as project management experience. In addition, has solid knowledge, skills and experience with SFDC standard out of the box functionality and creating innovative custom applications on the Force.com platform. This includes experience with using Apex and Visual force in an Agile environment. The Location: Hightstown, NJ Responsibilities: Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in the development of Custom Applications on the Salesforce.com Platform and integration with Enterprise Systems. Provide project requirements, technical design, integration architecture, solution recommendations, ROM estimates and detailed requirements. Govern change management process from backlog to production across the development lifecycle. Ensure that all necessary changes are documented, reviewed, tested, approved, deployed and communicated to stakeholders. Provide technical insight to Platts for Salesforce.com and integration with various Systems (Zuora, SpringCM, Xactly, Qlik, Office 365, ShowPad, Eloqua/Marketo, Survey tool, Web Chat and Telephony systems) Remain current on new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvement. Develop a vision for the future state of that landscape Manage stakeholders and serve as principle point of contact for Senior/Executive leadership Be the principle interface between Commercial teams and corporate IT as well as with contacts at Salesforce.com Additional Responsibilities: Direct and supervise the SFDC Product owner and CRM administrators Develop a keen and comprehensive understanding of the current CRM landscape Managing the creation of training materials for cross departmental business use Required Skills: Detailed knowledge of Salesforce.com Sales, Service and Marketing Clouds, Communities, SF1 and Lightening Experience in designing and executing against a long-term Salesforce.com strategy required Experience with APEX, Visual Force Experience with Salesforce Integration concepts using Soap or Rest API Web Services to various IT Systems (Salesforce to Salesforce, Adobe, Oracle, SharePoint) Experience managing relationship Technical staff Understanding of SQL, SOQL and SOSL queries Strong understanding of Relational Databases and ETL integration (My SQL, Oracle, Informatica, Salesforce Connector) Experience using Salesforce.com data tools (Data Loader, Excel Connector, CRM Fusion) Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills A strong focus and a capacity to collaborate with partners to troubleshoot and optimize processes Ability to analyze and creatively solve complex business and technical problems Strong MS Office skills, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio Ability to lead and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously Required Experience/Certificates/Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or Related Field Salesforce Certifications: Salesforce Certified Platform Developer, Application Developer (DEV-401/501), Advanced Salesforce Administrator (ADM-211); Sales Cloud Consultant (ADM-251) 5+ years Salesforce Platform experience About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Platts Analytics Account Executive - Midmarkets The Location: Denver, CO The Team: This is an opportunity to join a dynamic sales team within Platts that focuses on expanding our energy analytics business. Our portfolio of products is constantly evolving, so we are looking for someone who can learn new markets and products quickly. This is a fast-paced and progressive team, and we are looking for a self-driven individual who can be successful in growing our energy business in the U.S. Southern region. The Impact: The Account Executive is responsible for finding new client accounts and growing and nurturing existing customers within a North American territory through. The individual will be collaborating with Platts Business Development Managers in a subject matter expert capacity. This role will also be responsible for providing product feedback to the Bentek analytical team. What’s in it for you: Opportunity to be a part of one of the largest energy analytics providers in North America. Exposure to Top Energy Producers, Investment Banks, Midstream Companies, and Fortune 500 companies Opportunity to work with top energy market experts and analysts Accessibility to gain a deeper market understanding for Global oil, gas, and NGLs. Responsibilities: Meets and exceeds revenue quotas. Extensive Customer facing activity including prospecting new clients, ongoing development of existing accounts and driving new product sales. Understand in depth set territory, customer accounts and bank of business; develop and implement comprehensive customer centric account strategy and territory plan. Develop and build meaningful relationships with key and influential contacts; Collaborate with other sales and sales support functions to help ensure service levels and value-add needs are met Manage renewals and strengthen relationships within existing accounts. Service customers and prospects with quotes, demos and sample products. Prospecting new business and manage incoming leads. Maintain a high lead to sales close conversion rate. Maintain Salesforce activity log; Provide monthly reports to management; Produce an accurate monthly forecast; Build strong profiles for top 10 clients. What We’re Looking For:Basic Qualifications: Minimum 3+ years’ experience in a B2B sales corporate environment Excellent organization and communication skills both written and verbal; Must utilize strong phone, interpersonal and sales prospecting skills. Adds value to the customer relationship by distilling, summarizing, interpreting and communicating information to facilitate its usefulness. Strong time management, multi-tasking and organization skills. Strong business and professional acumen. Superior customer relationship management skills. Consultative/Solution sales and strong negotiation skills Highly proficient in excel (pivot tables and charts) and using CRM systems Ability to travel up to 40% Strong analytical skills Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years’ experience in downstream oil, gas, or power industry 2+ years’ experience in energy commodity analytics About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Governance and Controls Administrator – IT Operations S&P Global Ratings is seeking a Governance and Controls Administrator to monitor and mature Operational controls within the organization. This position will ensure that Operational controls meet regulatory and audit requirements as well as align to industry best practices including IT SOX. The candidate will be working closely with IT counter parts to monitor that controls meet defined and documented requirements. The position will also be responsible for enhancing and further automating monitoring process to allow for broader coverage across the Ratings IT portfolio of applications. The individual will report to the Director of IT Operations who leads the Governance function. The IT Operations Governance team includes global coverage of the Change Management function as well as enabling our Controls Monitoring function for regular review and reports of operating controls around our applications and infrastructure. The candidate will need to work collaboratively across the organization and must be able to follow-up on open items, develop meeting agendas and produce project plans and metrics to move initiatives forward. In addition, the candidate must be able to manage multiple project streams simultaneously. Activities will include planning and executing the assessment activities, participating in meetings, ensuring the appropriate level of management review on action items and responses, and tracking commitments to closure. Responsibilities: Monitor weekly, monthly, quarterly and bi-annual IT Operational controls Document and demonstrate monitoring activity Provide primary support for yearly SOX IT audit exam for Ratings IT Operations Further institutionalize segregation of duties control across Ratings IT applications Define opportunities for automation of monitoring IT controls Track action plans to completion, monitor and report on IT risk and IT control related activities Manage a portfolio of activities related to planning and executing the IT control assessment activities Strong technical Information security and IT risk management background Outstanding business acumen and communication skills Ability to understand and convey IT control and risk management concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences Provides IT control expertise while working with the businesses and other risk partners Critical thinking and problem solving skills Align to other relevant control assessment activities within the organization Align with findings and management responses resulting from other control assessments with touchpoints Produce regular metrics, reporting, and escalation of items for attention Works in collaboration with other teams to build best practices Conduct reviews of current processes with recommendations on auditing, reporting and exception identification and remediation Reviews IT documentation Required Qualifications Bachelors required or higher degree preferred Strong technology background Experience in the following areas: technology, project management; process management, IT audit and quality control Excellent organizational and team building skills Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with the ability to inspire others to find creative solutions to challenging situations or problems Demonstrates a strong understanding of technology and business including business processes Ability to grasp complex concepts and synthesize towards solutions Problem solver that is resourceful and creative Excellent organizational skills communicate effectively with all levels of management Demonstrated ability to deliver projects that meet the business objectives within scope and schedule Creative, results driven, self-motivated, and solutions oriented to execute projects Demonstrated skills in tailoring presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group vs. executive management) Track record of superior performance with emphasis on quality, ability to deliver timely results Ability to operate in a complex, fast paced, matrix environment Willingness to be hands-on and detailed oriented Able to demonstrate leadership, practical approach and ability to influence and negotiate with others. Preferred Qualifications Understanding of basic project management practices; PMP or Six Sigma certification a plus Experience in Technology Audit, and possess an understanding of key Technology general controls and risk mitigation procedures is preferred Experience in Financial Services Understanding of regulatory landscape for Technology Information Systems Auditor (CISA) and Certified Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) certifications preferred Understanding and knowledge of SharePoint About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job. JobTitle: Associate, U.S. Public Finance - Transportation Infrastructure Group
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Associate, U.S. Public Finance – Transportation Infrastructure Group The Location: (Flexible) Chicago, IL / Dallas, TX / Centennial, CO / San Francisco, CA The Team: You will join a very collegial and professional team of analysts that are located, and that work on credits across the country. We are a national team looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly. Ratings analysts are a key part of the success of the department and make meaningful contributions every day. The Impact: You will be able to contribute to the team and company in a meaningful way. You will be integrated into a group with high expectations and can expect to have a notable impact. What’s in it for you: This position is a mid-level position, but with expectations for upward mobility. Advancement will be available to those who show a strong aptitude and embrace the municipal sector. While overall career development will depend on individual performance and company need, this is an opportunity for your skills and hard work to move you forward. Responsibilities: As an Associate, you will participate in the evaluation of the credit quality of governmental enterprises—specifically transportation—as it relates to their ability to repay debt obligations. You will be responsible for aggregating data and information to present to rating committees. You will interact with clients, make presentations, and prepare reports for internal and external distribution. This position will also include managing and processing large data sets. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:• MBA, MPA, MPP or similar advanced degree preferred• BS, BA in finance, accounting, economics, government/public policy, or similar field required• Minimum 2+ years of relevant work experience required• A demonstrated interest in municipal enterprises and how they work • Strong work ethic and ability to work well both independently and as part a team • Strong ability to work with financial models and data, including cash flow and credit models • Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with clients • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to learn in both formal training and on-the-job settings • Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven environment • Ability to be highly organized, detail-oriented, and juggle multiple priorities at once About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: We are a premier sector-focused news and financial information provider, is looking fora Lead Project Manager with a strong Salesforce background to join our Information Platforms team in our office located in Charlottesville or Richmond, VA. The Impact: You will work alongside Salesforce Solutions Architect and other Salesforce team members. You will use your Salesforce Platform skills experience to help improve our Salesforce Platform. You will be involved in strategic that will enhance the platform including working in all areas of Salesforce, from Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, App Partners, Lightning, Wave and more. The Career Opportunity: Would you like the opportunity to work on a team that will craft the future of the S&P Global Market Intelligence Salesforce Instance? Do you love being part of a team committed to delivering excellence? This position will enable you to interact with a agile team of in house Salesforce professionals from around the world. You will also have been instrumental in implementing Salesforce best practices and utilize your technical project management skills to lead projects from conception to completion in an Agile environment across one or multiple CRM teams. The Team / The Business: Our team is responsible for the management and improvements of the Business Applications that drive the S&P Global Market Intelligence Division. The team leads many internal applications from Salesforce, Order to Cash, Order Fulfillment, Reporting and Workflow tools. You will have the opportunity every single day to work with people from a wide variety of backgrounds and are able to develop a close team dynamic with coworkers from around the globe. Job Responsibilities: Lead design discussions and work with technical teams to implement new features and continuausly improve the platform Lead projects for Salesforce.com implementations or customizations Work with CRM professionals and partners to build customized solutions that support the business requirements Identify ways to better utilize Salesforce for business process, make recommendations on improvements Support change management process for new improvements into production Manage projects from an Agile perspective end to end Experience and proficiency with a variety of items including: 6+ Years as a Salesforce Professional Salesforce Certifications required Technical background in Computer Science or Software Engineering Able to analyze requirements, resolve, document and communicate the optimal design approach Excellent partner management skills Experience working in an Agile/Scrum Organization About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit, S&P Global Market Intelligence To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Are you interested in Cloud, automation, and integration? We want to provide Cloud as a service. And we need talent for a key IT initiative to migrate all applications and data to public Cloud. We want to create a pipeline where everything in the Cloud is automated, secure, and immutable. Responsibilities Enable application migration to public and private Cloud Become subject matter expert in application integration for Cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments Provide integration support of Cloud applications Develop automation to enable Dev, QA and Operations teams to work seamlessly in the Cloud Provide new service offerings through application integration and education Manage and maintain cloud inventory and costs Desired Expertise Expert level: AWS, configuration management tools (ansible, salt, chef, puppet), common Cloud migration techniques, Cloud native application design patterns, Cloud operations tools and processes such as infrastructure provisioning, application monitoring, governance, and financial optimization Proficient with: common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Jira Nice to have: knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM SoftLayer, or Rackspace, ServiceNow, ITIL, Docker containers DevOps Experience Experience with installation, configuration and management of common DevOps tools like Git, Jenkins, Artifactory, and Ansible or similar configuration management languages Experience working in agile and collaborative DevOps teams Experience building and migrating applications to DevOps process Desired Experience 5 to 10 years of industry experiences, with 2+ years working in public cloud environments Experience working with/for shared service providers with 2+ years creating solutions Experience working in enterprise (large scale, high complexity) IT organizations Experience building cloud-native applications Experience migrating application from traditional datacenters to public cloud Experience migrating applications from dedicated hardware to virtualized stack such as VMWare Experience in an operational role – monitoring, system administration, ITSM, service levels, support escalations AWS certifications preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Quantitative Analyst/Data Scientist The Location: Boston, MA or Chicago, IL The Team: Our Quantamental Research group specializes in uncovering new anomalies and differentiated stock selection strategies. Integrated quantamental research products enable portfolio managers, quantitative analysts, and researchers to refine and differentiate their strategies to gain insights into new sources of potential alpha. Through their research, the group strives to combine the efficiency and breadth of the quantitative approach with the intuition, judgement and deep dive analysis of the fundamental approach. Areas of focus include: Event Driven Investing Industry-Specific Signals Supply Chain Interactions Insights from Academic Literature Alternative Data Sets Using the uniqueness and depth of S&P Global Market Intelligence's combined data and analytics offerings, the research group uncovers new investment insights in their monthly publications. Research findings are frequently cited by mainstream industry publications, including: The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, and Fortune, among others. The Impact: This role has both an internal research component and an externally facing component. The internal research role component consists of exploring and testing investment thesis and thoroughly documenting your results. The team’s research is often featured in top-tier media publications. The external aspect of this role involves communicating the actionable investment insights and solutions resulting from the research. The channels for communication are broad, including: industry events, webinars, and face to face meetings with institutional investment practitioners. You will spend a significant amount of time interacting with clients around investment solutions. What’s in it for you: This role is the opportunity to join our Quantamental Research team. This team of Global Equity Investment Researchers conducts innovative, industry leading investment research on which derived content is created. This research is the basis for in depth client interaction and the creation of derived content and analytics. Responsibilities: You will face interesting challenges and be counted on to creatively determine how best to get your job done. You will... Conduct hands-on, actionable innovative research around investment strategies using the entire suite of data and analytics at S&P Global. Collaborate with team members around a variety of research initiatives. All members of the research team drive their own research and support other team members on their initiatives. Publish industry leading research in white papers, blogs, research briefs. Present at sponsored and industry events and conduct webinars. Work closely with sales as a subject matter expert, providing proof statements to clients around research. Work with marketing around thematic research strategies. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Master’s degree in Statistics, Physical Sciences, Finance, or Technology required 3-5 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: CFA (or working towards) Demonstrable knowledge of statistics and econometrics; as well as capital markets, particularly global equities Expertise in Machine Learning, NLP and have data science experience Able to establish credibility with clients and fellow team members around investment management ideas Real passion for asset management, capital markets and portfolio risk management Strong technical and programming skills in one or more high level programming languages such Clarifi, EXCEL, R, MatLab, SQL Organized and detail oriented. High degree of comfort with large datasets Deep analytical mindset and understanding of either a quantitative or fundamental investment approach Excellent presentation abilities Intellectual curiosity and inquisitiveness Ability to conduct investment research within a dynamic, team based culture Ability to explain complex investment concepts in simple terms About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Network Design Engineer The Location: Virginia (Charlottesville / Richmond) The Team: Through open communication and collaboration, The Network Design Team will provide and maintain a stable state of the art data and voice infrastructure that enables our customers to achieve maximum productivity and success. The Impact: Start every single day organized and with a deep understanding of our environment Over-communicate with each other and our users Constantly question ourselves, each other, our vendors and the status quo Work as a team to deliver premier service Pay strict attention to detail, provide timely response and excellent customer service What’s in it for you: Network Design You will be responsible for designing networks and extensions to networks. You will take into account bandwidth requirements, infrastructure requirements, security and potential network expansion. Plan ahead to accommodate growth. Direct involvement in projects requiring network design. Network Modeling Network modeling involves using information on existing network traffic and estimating the effects of growth on the network. Do you love being an integral part of company growth? You will help us grow by learning new applications, standing up new branch offices, additional users or a combination of the three. Responsibilities would also include modeling the effect that newer equipment might have on network performance to make accurate upgrade recommendations to management. Network Security You will be responsible for figuring out how additional firewalls or content filters will affect performance. Consider placement of such security equipment on the network and be sure it is installed at the proper location to provide maximum security with minimum performance impact. This is tightly tied with the security group. Responsibilities: Produce the network infrastructure architecture ensuring that the respective components support the overall solution architecture, Accountable for the network infrastructure integrity within an IT solution context. Leading design dependencies and impacts of change. Ensure the network components are aligned to the target operational and architectural models and conform with standards Lead design on medium and large sized Infrastructure projects Architecture needs/business requirements, and is both affordable and supportable. Analyze and explain the risks involved in adopting certain technology solutions Produce or tailor standard designs to meet client needs whilst maintaining recognized industry and/or Corporate standards. Contribute significantly to more complex solutions and may lead implementation or components within the design. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: 10+ years working in an enterprise environment with network support responsibilities. Cisco certification highly preferred. CCNP in routing/switching preferred. Experience with Switching L2/L3 and different platforms of Cisco switches Including Nexus Platform (5k / 9k) Experience with Wireless LAN technology and understanding of Cisco Access Points and Controllers Experience with Routing Protocols BGP/OSPF/EIGRP. Experience with Firewall / Security. Knowledgeable with installation and support of load balancer technology. F5 preferred. Knowledgeable with Security technologies i.e. Firewalls, VPN configuration, IDS, IPS, 802.1x, Internet Design, maintain, and modify VLAN topologies The applicant is required to have a deep understanding of TCP/IP, switching technologies (VLAN’s, STP, RSTP, VTP, 802.1x, VCP), Routing (EIGRP, BGP, redistribution, summarization), IP (subnets, CIDR, NAT, ACL’s, DNS, DHCP, WINS), VoIP, multicast protocols (PIM, IGMP, CGMP), QoS Cisco IOS, general knowledge around NTP, SNMP, Netflow, IWAN. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Are you interested in Cloud, automation, and integration? We want to provide Cloud as a service. And we need talent for a key IT initiative to migrate all applications and data to public Cloud. We want to create a pipeline where everything in the Cloud is automated, secure, and immutable. Responsibilities Enable application migration to public and private Cloud Become subject matter expert in application integration for Cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments Provide integration support of Cloud applications Develop automation to enable Dev, QA and Operations teams to work seamlessly in the Cloud Provide new service offerings through application integration and education Manage and maintain cloud inventory and costs Desired Expertise Expert level: AWS, configuration management tools (ansible, salt, chef, puppet), common Cloud migration techniques, Cloud native application design patterns, Cloud operations tools and processes such as infrastructure provisioning, application monitoring, governance, and financial optimization Proficient with: common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Jira Nice to have: knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM SoftLayer, or Rackspace, ServiceNow, ITIL, Docker containers Security Experience Experience working with AWS security configuration and management Experience setting up OS, middleware, and application level security Experience working with security tools like Snort, Qualys and Splunk Experience integrating applications with authentication providers Experience setting up application fine-grained entitlement using authorization providers Desired Experience 5 to 10 years of industry experiences, with 2+ years working in public cloud environments Experience working with/for shared service providers with 2+ years creating solutions Experience working in enterprise (large scale, high complexity) IT organizations Experience building cloud-native applications Experience migrating application from traditional datacenters to public cloud Experience migrating applications from dedicated hardware to virtualized stack such as VMWare Experience in an operational role – monitoring, system administration, ITSM, service levels, support escalations AWS certifications preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
