Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description: The Enterprise Technology Architect will primarily be responsible to develop, evolve and maintain the enterprise technology architecture, technology products and standards in support of evolving business and technical strategies and objectives. Collaborate with Enterprise Architects, Solution, Data and Infrastructure Architects to develop enterprise technology policies, principles, standards, blueprints and patterns to be used across S&P Global. Will also serve as the technology champion for Enterprise Architecture working with the technical domain product engineering teams to ratify technical solutions at the Enterprise Architecture Council and refine/evolve the technology domain product roadmaps. Provide architectural guidance, governance on projects and maintain alignment between business strategies and business/technical architecture frameworks. An information technology professional with demonstrated architecture capabilities, a problem solver, and a strategic thinker; is adaptable to and drives change through thought leadership, education, communication, partnership and results. The Team: You will be an expert contributor and part of the Global Technology’s Cloud Services & Enterprise Architecture Team. This team, who has a broad and expert knowledge on many technology stacks and architectural patterns, fosters knowledge sharing and collaboration that results in a unified strategy. All architecture members provide leadership, innovation, timely delivery, and the ability to articulate business value. Be a part of a unique opportunity to build and evolve S&P’s Global Enterprise Architecture and Cloud Services strategy. Our Hiring Manager Says: If you are an individual who has the passion for driving change and implementing diverse aspects of technology architecture, this is an excellent opportunity. I am looking for someone with a strong technology architecture background, implemented or been part of an Enterprise Architecture program, strong leadership skills, thinks out of the box, brings in innovative ideas, and elevates our architecture from current state to target state. Responsibilities: Lead and facilitate the creation of governing principles and policies to guide EA decision-making. Analyze the current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies and work with Enterprise Architecture leads and the Enterprise Architecture Council to recommend solutions for improvement. Capture end-to-end current state and develop target state technology architecture and standards for the enterprise. Create architectural technology and business roadmaps that result in stronger business/IT alignment and drive adoption and usage of technology across the enterprise. Oversee and facilitate the evaluation and selection of new technology capabilities and product standards. Collaborate with technology domain product engineering to develop and communicate domain-wide policies, standards, guidelines and procedures and manage the technology portfolio and product lifecycle. Establish architecture governance processes that enable the evolution of enterprise technology, manage exceptions and non-conformance. Institute practices that guides the creation of application remediation plans to eradicate retired/obsolete/declining products. Provide leadership on initiatives on enterprise technologies and platforms such as portal, workflow, publishing, SOA, caching, cloud and analytics, mobile and others and ensure adherence to standard technologies. Establish compliance measures and reporting routines that monitors progress to drive business value. Your Skills: BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Information Technology. 10+ years of Information Technology experience. Expertise with of Enterprise Architecture processes, methods, and frameworks, including proficiency in business process modeling and redesign, requirements management, and research tools. Build architecture roadmaps, monitor industry trends and directions; develops and presents substantive technical recommendations to senior management. Experience with a wide variety technology domains – application technology domain (such as business process management, portals, integration platforms, API management...), security technology services (identity management, encryption, key management…), Infrastructure technology services (servers, OS, storage…), DevOps, Cloud CSPs (AWS, Azure…), and other leading edge technologies. Knowledge of Agile approaches to software development and able to put key Agile principles into practice to deliver solutions incrementally. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with strong ability to influence both IT and business partners. Analytical thinking and problem solving skills with an ability to negotiate and trade-off technology options against goals and cost. Ability to handle multiple projects/efforts simultaneously and prioritize and manage work to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment. About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Are you interested in Cloud, automation, and integration? We want to provide Cloud as a service. And we need talent for a key IT initiative to migrate all applications and data to public Cloud. We want to create a pipeline where everything in the Cloud is automated, secure, and immutable. Responsibilities: Enable application migration to public and private Cloud Become subject matter expert in application integration for Cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments Provide integration support of Cloud applications Develop automation to enable Dev, QA and Operations teams to work seamlessly in the Cloud Provide new service offerings through application integration and education Manage and maintain cloud inventory and costs Desired Expertise: Expert level: AWS, configuration management tools (ansible, salt, chef, puppet), common Cloud migration techniques, Cloud native application design patterns, Cloud operations tools and processes such as infrastructure provisioning, application monitoring, governance, and financial optimization Proficient with: common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Jira Nice to have: knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM SoftLayer, or Rackspace, ServiceNow, ITIL, Docker containers API Experience: Experience working with SOA, Web Services, REST APIs and Messaging Experience with installation, configuration and management of API and Messaging platforms Experience developing highly available services with service definitions, security, and monitoring Experience writing code in Java and SQL Desired Experience: 5 to 10 years of industry experiences, with 2+ years working in public cloud environments Experience working with/for shared service providers with 2+ years creating solutions Experience working in enterprise (large scale, high complexity) IT organizations Experience building cloud-native applications Experience migrating application from traditional datacenters to public cloud Experience migrating applications from dedicated hardware to virtualized stack such as VMware Experience in an operational role – monitoring, system administration, ITSM, service levels, support escalations AWS certifications preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. JobTitle: Associate, U.S. Public Finance - Transportation Infrastructure Group
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Associate, U.S. Public Finance – Transportation Infrastructure Group The Location: (Flexible) Chicago, IL / Dallas, TX / Centennial, CO / San Francisco, CA The Team: You will join a very collegial and professional team of analysts that are located, and that work on credits across the country. We are a national team looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly. Ratings analysts are a key part of the success of the department and make meaningful contributions every day. The Impact: You will be able to contribute to the team and company in a meaningful way. You will be integrated into a group with high expectations and can expect to have a notable impact. What’s in it for you: This position is a mid-level position, but with expectations for upward mobility. Advancement will be available to those who show a strong aptitude and embrace the municipal sector. While overall career development will depend on individual performance and company need, this is an opportunity for your skills and hard work to move you forward. Responsibilities: As an Associate, you will participate in the evaluation of the credit quality of governmental enterprises—specifically transportation—as it relates to their ability to repay debt obligations. You will be responsible for aggregating data and information to present to rating committees. You will interact with clients, make presentations, and prepare reports for internal and external distribution. This position will also include managing and processing large data sets. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:• MBA, MPA, MPP or similar advanced degree preferred• BS, BA in finance, accounting, economics, government/public policy, or similar field required• Minimum 2+ years of relevant work experience required• A demonstrated interest in municipal enterprises and how they work • Strong work ethic and ability to work well both independently and as part a team • Strong ability to work with financial models and data, including cash flow and credit models • Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with clients • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to learn in both formal training and on-the-job settings • Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven environment • Ability to be highly organized, detail-oriented, and juggle multiple priorities at once About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), the Solutions Delivery MD is responsible for the strategic implementation of technology solutions that improve business efficiency, enable commercialization and de-risk the franchise while meeting S&P business goals. Represents the needs of the business to IT by working closely with the business to gain in-depth understanding of their strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. Serves as the liaison and bridges the gap between the business and IT by gaining insight and domain knowledge into the customer’s current and future states in order to recommend technology solutions that align IT with the customer’s business strategy. Improves communication and collaboration, identifies technologies and improvement opportunities, and ensures teams are aligned to meet overall business goals. Leads all matters related to the assessment and delivery of technology needs for the business, to include defining requirements, setting expectations, collaborating with various parties, and implementing technical solutions necessary to meet S&P’s mission, objectives, emerging issues, and future needs. Influencing a diverse set of constituents, and understanding, reengineering and running processes across the entire enterprise. The Solutions Delivery MD manages relationships to set expectations, keeps communication channels open between business personnel and IT, and communicates regularly with internal customers at all levels. Serves as an IT expert adviser by providing up-to-date technical expertise for a wide range of information technology issues and operations. Collaborates regularly with IT management to ensure new ideas are assessed within the context of business, data, application development, and system architectures. Responsibilities: Drive the development of, implementation of, and adherence to strategic initiatives within the specific IT discipline for the company. Involve senior executives in the development and understanding of the plans and initiatives and help manage the IT team in the execution of the plan. Promote an organization that is user focused and renders outstanding customer service, high performance, teamwork, and accountability. Ensure that roles and responsibilities are clear for all team members and establish goals, objectives, and operating procedures. Drive the identification and delivery of the various tactical initiatives and tasks that support the execution of the approved strategies for S&P. Provide effective leadership and exercise day-to-day management of assigned staff. Set priorities among competing goals and objectives and coordinates simultaneous workflows to ensure efficient contribution to S&P objectives. Develop, implement and maintain policies in conjunction with S&P stakeholders to ensure the effective and efficient identification, acquisition and management of technologies. Define and execute an information management strategy to advance the vision and mission of S&P. Develop and manage IT related project plans, budgets and performance targets, including the management of the related employee and contractor workforce. Contribute to and support S&P enterprise architecture, information security and IT strategic plans, including documentation of the current state and future state, and establishment and management of migration plan to achieve future improvements in efficiency and effectiveness. Approve multi-year and long range work plans and assist in the management of the overall IT portfolio. Qualifications: Must possess a Bachelor’s degree, Master’s Degree preferred; 15+ years of experience with a minimum of 10 years of technical leadership and at least 5 years of business development experience; Demonstrated experience in a strategic, leadership role in at least one of the following areas: client relations, communications, information technology, and/or operations; Very strong relationship-building, exceptional analytical, interpersonal and communications skills; as well as the ability to influence decision-makers and stakeholders; Significant understanding of workflow processes with the ability to identify weaknesses and implement process improvements; Outstanding program and project management skills, organizational skills, execution planning and control competency; Proven ability to motivate and develop staff and build high-performing teams; Proven ability in providing excellent customer service while recognizing the challenges of driving and embedding change in a rapidly moving environment; Proven ability to work to defined deadlines and prioritize workload; Proven ability to develop positive working relationships, both internal and external, and to be seen as a highly credible representative of the business. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: As a Lead Solutions Engineer, you will be a Java stack solutions architect for the web operations team, crafting and implementing technology to support our revenue-generating products. In this high-impact role, you would be accountable for projects delivered to business feature releases that require application and infrastructure solutions, integration or consolidation of services. The Location: Charlottesville, VA or Richmond, VA The Team: Web Operations caters to the technology and application delivery and operations for the Market Intelligence Product Suite including Capital IQ Platform, Content Collections and XpressFeed to name a few. We provide continuous delivery expertise for product and related infrastructure while striving to ensure full availability of the platform. The Impact: The work you do will impact end-users every single day and serves as the foundation for our dedication to providing clients with data that delivers results. What’s in it for you: Build a career with a global company Build and improve your skills by working with new technologies Get in at the start of our shift into cloud-based structure and DevOps culture Responsibilities: Design, build and configure system infrastructures in support of web-based/cloud applications Fix and resolve system problems of a complex nature; specifically after changes were made by the solution engineering team such as modifying an existing solution, adding capacity or implementing a new solution Cultivate a true DevOps culture by visiting and effectively collaborating with R&D groups in domestic and global sites Champion a reciprocal environment by gathering feedback and freely sharing ideas among teammates Work closely with multi-functional teams comprised of personnel from Infrastructure & Operations, Development, Quality Assurance, and End user communities Prioritize and effectively manage time supporting multiple concurrent efforts What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: 10+ years of Java Application Server WebSphere/Tomcat experience; JVM tuning experience Strong functional knowledge of and hands-on experience with operating systems and scripting Possess a good work ethic and be willing & available to work extended hours and weekends as necessary to complete work you're leading as well as attend specially scheduled events such as weekend performance tests or major technology upgrades, major releases and client migrations. Strong analytical skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Accountability and dedicated focus to solution being engineered Preferred Qualifications: Experience with containers (Docker) and cloud (AWS) technologies Experience with Elasticsearch ELK stack Java/J2EE development experience in a WebLogic/Tomcat Experience developing automated procedures for systems management in hybrid cloud Capacity planning, resource utilization and monitoring, trending, and correlation of resource utilization with key system processes and service levels Application performance tuning experience and insight AppDynamics/New Relic/Dynatrace experience About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: We are a premier sector-focused news and financial information provider, is looking fora Lead Project Manager with a strong Salesforce background to join our Information Platforms team in our office located in Charlottesville or Richmond, VA. The Impact: You will work alongside Salesforce Solutions Architect and other Salesforce team members. You will use your Salesforce Platform skills experience to help improve our Salesforce Platform. You will be involved in strategic that will enhance the platform including working in all areas of Salesforce, from Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, App Partners, Lightning, Wave and more. The Career Opportunity: Would you like the opportunity to work on a team that will craft the future of the S&P Global Market Intelligence Salesforce Instance? Do you love being part of a team committed to delivering excellence? This position will enable you to interact with a agile team of in house Salesforce professionals from around the world. You will also have been instrumental in implementing Salesforce best practices and utilize your technical project management skills to lead projects from conception to completion in an Agile environment across one or multiple CRM teams. The Team / The Business: Our team is responsible for the management and improvements of the Business Applications that drive the S&P Global Market Intelligence Division. The team leads many internal applications from Salesforce, Order to Cash, Order Fulfillment, Reporting and Workflow tools. You will have the opportunity every single day to work with people from a wide variety of backgrounds and are able to develop a close team dynamic with coworkers from around the globe. JobTitle: Paralegal & Contracts Operation Specialist - S&P Global Platts - New York
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Paralegal & Contracts Operation Specialist – S&P Global Platts – London or New York Role Purpose: The successful candidate will perform various Paralegal tasks and be responsible for the management and operation of the Platts contract management system and other technical and centralized applications that support Platts globally. In addition to contract management and administration, this position will assist the Platts legal team with paralegal functions such as trademark administration, due diligence on corporate transactions, corporate entity and tax support, document discovery and various other tasks. The Impact: Manage contract administration and database, and other technical and centralized applications that support the Platts legal team on a global basis, including by interacting with the Platts technology team and external vendors to ensure ongoing functionality of such technology and implementation of updates. Responsible for administering a variety of contracts including service agreements, customer contracts, vendor contracts, software licenses, NDAs, amendments, order forms and related documents. Manage new requests submitted for legal support with such agreements in the contract management database. Ensure timely and accurate recording of routed agreements into contract management system and that all executed agreements are entered into the contract database in a timely and accurate fashion. Work with the Platts legal team Platts sales and business management (including sales administration, product managers) to incorporate new processes and procedures into the contract process in an effort to integrate improvement/efficiencies in the contract process through new technology, etc. The Career Opportunity: Ensure integrity and accuracy of the information in the database. Conduct periodic reviews to confirm integrity and accuracy of information in the database and provide recommendations on continued improvements to the application. Ensure that all information obtained by the Platts legal team is entered into the Applications on an accurate and timely basis (including, among other things, terminations and assignments). Assist with trademark administration for the Platts business, including working with colleagues on the SPGI legal team and outside counsel to manage trademark administration. Assist with due diligence in corporate transactions and integration tasks for acquisitions. Assist the Platts legal team and colleagues in the corporate functions with corporate secretarial/entity and tax-related work. Assist inside and outside counsel with document discovery in various legal matters as they arise. The Team/Business: S&P Global (NYSE:S&P Global) is an operational company providing financial and industry data, research, news and analytics to investment professionals, government agencies, corporations, and universities worldwide. S&P Global Platts is the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to Platts expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. Platts is headquartered in London and employs over 1,000 people in more than 15 offices worldwide. Qualification: Bachelor Degree or the equivalent legal qualifications Previous working experience in a Paralegal position within a corporate environment Legal, Licensing & Market Data exposure is essential Knowledge of contract databases and other information management tools. Spring CM is highly sought after Proven management skills and the ability to develop employees The ability to draft documentation and be able to present and articulate About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Contract Negotiator The Location: Charlottesville, VA The Impact: Reporting to Assistant General Counsel, you are responsible for managing the negotiation and drafting process of a variety of contracts including service agreements, customer contracts, software licenses, amendments and order forms. This position requires the ability to manage the demands of S&P Global's sales and business organization while also ensuring that policies and procedures relating to the contract process are followed. The Business: We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, S&P Global Market Intelligence, S&P Global Platts, and S&P Dow Jones Indices. What’s in it for you: In this role, you will have the opportunity to draft and negotiate contract agreements that are crucial to our commercial organization. Responsibilities: Responsible for managing the negotiation process of a variety of contracts including service agreements, customer contracts, software licenses, amendments, order forms and related documents; work directly with internal and external clients in the contract negotiation process, including ensuring that sales and business personnel comply with department policies and procedures in this regard. Negotiate, draft and finalize agreements and amendments with the goal of memorializing product license/contractual relationships between S&P Global and its clients. Work with legal team on escalation and approval issues. Review and proofread all work product (including final versions of contracts for signature) for typographical errors, proper formatting, references to and insertion of exhibits, etc. Assist the legal team as needed, in, among other things, handling of more customized transactions and the drafting of boilerplate forms. Strong knowledge of contracts database for purposes of: (a) summarizing and cataloguing provisions from negotiated deals; (b) ensuring that the correct contract documents are being leveraged; and (c) data entry, as needed. Strong knowledge of legal department website, the additional contract provisions dictionary, and other forms and applications that are part of the contract process. Work with department management, as needed, to create efficiencies and set and enforce policies and procedures relating to contract process. Special projects as assigned by management team. Involvement/leadership in a variety of projects, including due diligence activities related to acquisitions and divestitures, archiving, and other projects as needed. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Incumbent must have a college degree and at least 10+ years of related experience Strong contract negotiation and drafting and business writing skills; detail oriented Ability to work independently, directly with internal and external clients and escalate to attorneys as necessary. Awareness of pertinent business and legal issues to ensure consistent approach to contract documentation/transactions. Commercially aware individual with a strong working knowledge of contract and intellectual property issues. Must be able to juggle multiple priorities at once. Incumbent must have excellent organizational skills, communicate effectively with all levels of management within S&P and customer and vendor firms, and the ability to think outside the box in order to provide solutions. Incumbent must also keep current with the rapidly evolving industry trends and practices, as they relate to among other things, the financial industry, intellectual property, technology, etc. About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Are you ready to start your career in research? Do you want to develop a deep understanding of financial markets? As an assistant analyst, you will support the Leveraged Commentary & Data Group (LCD) by collecting and analyzing information and maintaining the proprietary database. The Location: New York, NY The Team: We are a team of nearly 30 analysts and reporters who work every single day to combine real-time news and trend analysis on U.S. and European leveraged loan, high-yield bond, distressed debt and corporate markets. Do you crave feedback? Are you passionate about quality? If so, you will love our dynamic team environment, partnering closely with mentors to continually improve data quality and the timely publication of data. The Impact: Our trend analysis, research and reports contextualize the current market against 20 years of historical data. Your work relates to data providers in the marketplace, information input into the index, and outpost reports provided back to our clients. What's in it for you: Develop your analytical skills and research abilities. Explore a highly-rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards. Learn from industry-leading analysts and experts. Responsibilities: Build and update leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market. Aggregate information from market sources. Support the production lifecycle for research reports and analysis. Partner with senior analysts and other group members on data collection processes and analysis projects. Build a deep knowledge of leveraged finance markets. This includes the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation. What We're Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Bachelors’ degree in business or related discipline Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices Strong attention to detail and a keen eye for accuracy. Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience in finance or accounting Experience with research and analysis of financial statements or market data Knowledge of MS Access or relational databases About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Manager, Financial Analysis The Location: New York, NY – 55 Water Street The Impact: The role is part of the Market Intelligence Global Financial Planning & Analysis team, which is essential in providing monthly reporting and analysis on financial performance across revenue, expense, EBITA and balance sheet. The Business: S&P Global Market Intelligence is a leading provider of financial and industry data, research, news and analytics to investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities worldwide. We combine broad data, powerful analytics and deep sector intelligence to give our clients unrivaled insight into the companies and markets they follow. What’s in it for you: There will be opportunities to be involved in ad-hoc projects with particular emphasis around process improvement and being part of a LEAN, efficient team focused on employing best practices. Responsibilities: Complete monthly consolidated Market Intelligence reporting for review by Senior Finance and Business Leadership Partner with Global MI Finance team to complete variance explanations on actual and historical results compared to budget and prior year for onward reporting to S&P Global Corporate Accounting group and Finance leadership to include both P&L and Balance Sheet variance Respond to both internal and external audit queries and ensuring full compliance internal controls (SOX) providing evidence as required. Assist with the preparation of presentations including Quarterly Financial Review, Quarterly Business Review and Board of Director meetings What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance or part/fully qualified accountant with 4+years’ proven accounting and financial analysis experience of working in a Global Finance organization operating within a matrix business structure Strong skills in MS Excel (pivot tables, V-lookups) and PowerPoint (ThinkCell an advantage). Quality – is attentive to detail and accuracy, is committed to excellence, looks for improvements continuously, monitors quality levels, finds root cause of quality problems, owns/act acts on quality problems Dependability – meets commitments, works independently, accepts accountability, handles changes, sets personal standards, stays focused under pressure and meets attendance/punctuality requirements. Productivity – manages a fair workload, volunteers for additional work, prioritizes tasks, develops good work procedures, manages time well and handles information flow. Create Superior Customer Value – cultivate long-term, strategic customer relationships by ensuring that the customer’s perspective is the driving force behind business activities, anticipate customer needs and understand criteria to determine whether success was achieved, accept responsibility for outcomes. Communicates Effectively – speak openly and clearly without hidden agendas, adapt your approach and your message to fit the audience. Seek input from others and use sound rationale to gain acceptance of ideas, listen actively and respond in a manner that promotes collaboration, persistently deliver important information and check for understanding to ensure your message is understood. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with ERP (Oracle Financials) and Cognos TM1 is essential. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. JobTitle: S&P Global Platts Commodity Associate Program - January 2018 Start
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : The Role: S&P Global Platts Commodity Associate Program is seeking candidates that will be involved in gathering and analyzing pricing information for benchmark for various commodities. The Location: Houston TX The Impact: Our real-time news, pricing and analytical services help markets operate with transparency and efficiency. Be part of a global company with a strong history of growth and a globally diverse workforce with 20 offices spanning five continents. Be known as a respected source of essential information and part of a renowned brand. Get the best of both worlds: a nimble, highly specialized company and a business casual culture with the benefits and backing of S&P Global – a company that fosters development and growth, as well as work-life balance. We are looking for world-class thinkers to join our team at S&P Global Platts, the principal provider of commodity price assessment and information to more than 10,000 customers in 150 countries. The content you generate and the relationships you build are essential to the markets. Associates expected to write insightful market commentaries that demonstrate Platts' thought leadership in the market, demonstrating our ability to spot key trends that help customers better anticipate market-moving events and phenomenon. What’s in it for you: 7-month rotational program commencing in January 2018 Commodity Associates receive four weeks of comprehensive training followed by two three month rotations in a different commodity sector – preparing you to move into a permanent price reporting role in one of our commodity teams. Opportunity to learn about various aspects of Oil, Power, Natural Gas, LNG, Coal, Petrochemicals, Metals, Agriculture and Shipping markets Exposure to a number of market subjects including supply and demand, infrastructure issues, geo-political issues, transportation and regulation, and how these subjects impact respective markets Commodity Associates will be trained to work in the price reporting function and will generate price assessments and content (content includes market commentary and news pieces, which power our pricing benchmarks) Commodity Associates will be involved in gathering data and market intelligence and conducting analysis on the assessment and reporting process The Team/The Business: You will be part of a global team in Platts Content. You are considered a specialist in the market(s) you will be working in and being a team player is very important in this role. Responsibilities: Gathers commodity price information and produces price assessments Reports and writes market commentaries and news analysis/features stories Develops and expands coverage of aligned commodities Develops, expands and maintains sources and contacts relevant to the market area of coverage Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree or completed a Master’s degree (preferred) by December 2017 Strong writing skills (preferred) Excellent communication skills (a clear concise writing style is essential together with good verbal skills, listening techniques) Team player with collaborative working style Able to learn quickly, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment and able to readjust priorities throughout the day to meet deadlines Understand the importance of building strong relationships and partnering with team members Problem-solving and critical thinking skills, attention to detail Intellectually curious; the ability to learn quickly and challenge Strong numeracy skills (including statistics; the ability to conceptualize proportional relationships; and an understanding of economic principles) Proficient with Excel and other Microsoft Office products (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint) To Learn More About Our Program Please Visit– https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2TC14NPPXFSgZpyEaa_SlqeA5Qas4YAc About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Assistant Brand Manager The Location: Charlottesville, VA The Team: As a member of brand marketing team you will have the opportunity to work in a friendly, professionally simulating, non-competitive environment where people champion and respect the contributions of individuals and collaborate to insure great results. The Impact: Play a key role in developing and managing new brand building initiatives internally and externally. Assist in developing communication strategy and executing all brand communication efforts. Know brand guidelines, inside and out, and ensure adherence through all channels. What’s in it for you: Opportunities for professional development include building out brand and marketing skills based on the diversity of internal and external marketing initiatives. Build business acumen with cross-functional interactions and varied work assignments. Career advancement within the brand team or more broadly within the marketing function across the organization is possible. Responsibilities: Partner with brand marketing team members and external agencies/suppliers to develop compelling messaging and creative in support of marketing efforts. Execute marketing tactics that deliver against brand positioning and business objectives. Track and analyze campaign performance and report on findings, including recommendations for future marketing initiatives. Regularly participate in cross-functional meetings communicating marketing plans and preparing key stakeholders for upcoming campaign efforts. Provide support as needed to Head of Brand and demonstrate flexibility in daily projects/work plan. Service ad hoc requests from Marketing and cross-functional teams. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree required. 3 years Brand Management/Marketing experience required Strong Project Management skills Ability to work independently with limited direction but also as part of a team Strong communication skills, both speaking and written Proven analytical and problem solving abilities Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite Strong attention to detail Demonstrated passion for brand marketing Preferred Qualifications: Degree in marketing or business preferred. 3 years creative/brand agency management experience preferred Knowledge and experience employing the latest trends in content strategy About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role The role provides the opportunity to work on cutting edge projects in the field of sustainable finance. The senior research analyst will be a key member of the Financial Institutions Delivery Team, dedicated to the support and development of Trucost’s services to banks, asset managers and pension funds globally. The analyst will carry out research on the environmental performance, risks and opportunities related to companies, investment products and how this translates into financial and societal impact for investors. The Impact The analyst will contribute to and be responsible for managing a broad range of research projects, including those of a bespoke nature and consultancy work. They will also work with the business development managers in managing client relationships and be involved in some sales support work including technical input for proposals and meetings with prospective clients. The role is client facing with the opportunity for travel. The Career Opportunity •In depth research on companies, industry sectors, regions, economies and thematics to report to the investment community. •Analyse the environmental performance and opportunities of investment products and portfolios using Trucost’s proprietary methods. •Research and update financial and environmental information on global listed companies using Trucost’s proprietary database. •Account Management – working with clients to advise on the integration and use of Trucost data and research in their investment and due diligence processes, and product creation; support them in the use of Trucost’s data and software, and answer technical questions. •Project Management of research delivery projects. •Representing Trucost at meetings with prospects alongside the business development manager, effectively recognising their needs and conveying Trucost’s value proposition. •Product development: identifying opportunities within the financial sector for applying Trucost’s data and analytics. The Team/Business S&P Dow Jones, a division of S&P Global, is the world's largest resource for index-based innovation, data and research. S&P Dow Jones Indices is at the forefront of index change and innovation, and has over 115 years of experience constructing innovative and transparent solutions that help investors achieve their financial goals. For more information, visit https://www.spglobal.com/ We are seeking a rigorous, hard worker, motivated and skilled team-player candidate who can demonstrate a high level of customer service and support the sales team in all queries in order to respond to customers and to maintain and enhance the quality and timeliness of our offerings. Qualifications•1+ years of experience •Working experience working in a financial institution in a role with exposure to corporate lending in a bank, credit risk, fundamental equities or corporate fixed income analysis or similar viewed favorably. •Ideally the candidate would also have environmental or ESG experience. This could include working as an analyst within an asset manager, pension fund or bank, helping to integrate environmental factors into the investment or lending decision making processes. Other relevant experience would include working as an ESG/RI analyst for a research provider or in the sustainability field for a management consultancy or Development Finance Institution. •The candidate must have a strong understanding of financial markets and investing, as well as knowledge of some of the following sustainability areas that financial institutions are involved in, such as, mainstreaming ESG integration, environmental fund or index creation, environmental risk analysis, green finance and reporting of investments in different asset classes. •The candidate must have excellent project management skills and be capable of leading complex projects in a client facing capacity and managing others within their project team. •Ideally the candidate would have an undergraduate and post graduate degree in relevant subjects such as; Economics, Finance, Environmental Economics, Development Economics or Environmental Sciences but this is not critical if work experience is very relevant. •Advanced Excel spreadsheet skills are required. •Fluent written and spoken English. Additional languages will be considered favorably. About S&P Dow Jones Indices At S&P Dow Jones Indices, our role can be described in one word: essential. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world; with over 1,000,000 indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices defines the way people measure and trade the markets. We provide essential intelligence that helps investors identify and capitalize on global opportunities. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Software Developer II The Location: Charlottesville or Richmond, VA The Team: External API team is responsible for client facing API that serves customers with millions of requests/day. The demand for content and usage grows every year. The team builds a scalable and robust solution for its customer. There are opportunities for innovation and learning new state of the art technologies. Quality is primary for the API as it is the fundamental source of data for many applications. The team is in geographically diverse location (NJ, NY, India, Denver) The Impact: API is primary to lot of internal products within the company. The use of restful API is trending among customers as well. Customers build their core products that depend on our API. We would be adding more content and features for the API in the next few years. What’s in it for you: API is the building block of many applications. Do you love working every single day crafting enterprise grade application that serves large customer base with growing demand and usage? You will use a wide range of technologies and opportunity to interact with different teams internally. Learning opportunity with participation in innovation projects, learning Big data, AWS cloud etc. Responsibilities: Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products. Using your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to develop, support, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software. Achieving an authoritative level of understanding of our customers’ environments and their use of our products. Building solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements Applying software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: At least 4 years (3 to 5) of experience on hands-on C# development and related technologies Has worked with back end technologies based on both C#,LINQ,Generics,ADO.NET,ENTITY FRAMEWORK,MVC,WEBAPI,OData Services,WCF and latest frameworks. You will have experience working with two or more of data related technologies and familiarity with others from various Relational databases, Nosql databases, Caching systems, Full Text Search engines, Big Data systems. Experience with the TDD approach, doing unit testing, mocking, integration/UI testing, behaviour driver testing. Experience setting up and configuring continuous integration and delivery systems, and code quality automation technologies. Knowledge of one or more architecture patterns and familiarity with others. Can resolve serious performance related issues by using various techniques, including testing, debugging and profiling. You have knowledge of front end technologies including templating, CSS and JS frameworks. Has good current hands-on development experience. Knowledge of complete product life cycles, quality metrics, evaluating technologies. A true “roll up the sleeves and get it done” working approach; demonstrated success as a problem solver, operating as a result-oriented, self-starter Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. JobTitle: Lead II, Information Security - Governance & Policy
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Role: This role will be responsible for creating, maintaining, implementing and enforcing policies, standards and procedures that support the Information Security organization. The analyst will function as an integral member of the Information Security team and collaborate with various security, business, audit and IT teams in order to develop and execute a comprehensive Information Security Policies & Governance Program. The lead will ensure that security policies, standards, guidelines, communication programs provide comprehensive, coherent, implementable and repeatable processes. Further, the analyst will assist in maintaining and evolving the necessary governance bodies to support Information Security working with the various S&P Global divisions. The lead will provide risk assessments and monitor risk tolerance and appetite. Finally, the lead will assist in regulatory responses, resulting management action plans and requisite follow-up. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for the creation and maintenance of Information Security policies, standards, guidelines and procedures. Translate standard frameworks, recommendations from subject matter experts, and industry best practices into high-quality, coherent and implementable policies, standards and procedures. Harmonize content of new and updated artifacts with other enterprise policies and standards and security frameworks. Work closely with the divisions to effectively implement them. Responsible for effectively communicating & highlighting content and roadmaps intended for varied audiences. Collaborate with the Information Security and Risk Management teams on policy and governance related issues and concerns in order to develop update and measure effectiveness of policies, standards and procedures. Create and maintain mechanisms for enforcing policies, procedures, etc. Ensure procedures and processes are relevant. Aid in integration with existing and new business processes. Collaborate with the Information Security team to integrate policies and standards related content into training & awareness programs. Establish the appropriate metrics and reporting to measure program effectiveness. Assist in formulating & enacting the necessary governance entities to support Information Security working with S&P Global divisions & Risk Management. Assist in formulating the risk framework for the group. Perform information security risk assessments, maintain the information security risk register, and assist in formulating risk tolerance and risk appetite in collaboration with the Chief Risk Officer’s office. Assist with regulatory responses, resulting management action plans and requisite follow-up. Support other Information Security processes and projects as necessary. Qualifications BS or MS - preferably in Computer Science with a concentration in Information Security. Security and risk management certification (e.g. CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, CISM, CRMA, CISO Certification – from an accredited institution) 5+ years working with IT risk and/or security; prior information security and risk management experience in a financial services company. Experience working in information security and demonstrable understanding of the concepts of information security. Experience with information security risk assessments and audit. Knowledgeable with Information Security laws and regulations. Knowledgeable with Information Security control frameworks and standards. Experience with NIST 800-53 Rev. 4; ISO 27001/2/5 and OWASP are a plus. Experience working with various financial regulatory entities (SEC, ESMA, FSA, MAS, et al) – a plus. Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate with various levels of the organization including technical as well as non-technical audiences. Great customer service and relationship management skills. Skilled in executive level presentations and briefings. Experience managing communication to internal customers. Demonstrated ability to think creatively while accounting for multiple perspectives in any given scenario. Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change. Must be able to work independently and with minimal direct supervision. Focused on how to best convey procedures and information clearly and concisely. Project Management experience is a plus. Excellent time management, organizational, and decision-making skills. Good judgment, tact, and decision-making ability. About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. JobTitle: Associate, U.S. Public Finance - Transportation Infrastructure Group
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Associate, U.S. Public Finance – Transportation Infrastructure Group The Location: (Flexible) Chicago, IL / Dallas, TX / Centennial, CO / San Francisco, CA The Team: You will join a very collegial and professional team of analysts that are located, and that work on credits across the country. We are a national team looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly. Ratings analysts are a key part of the success of the department and make meaningful contributions every day. The Impact: You will be able to contribute to the team and company in a meaningful way. You will be integrated into a group with high expectations and can expect to have a notable impact. What’s in it for you: This position is a mid-level position, but with expectations for upward mobility. Advancement will be available to those who show a strong aptitude and embrace the municipal sector. While overall career development will depend on individual performance and company need, this is an opportunity for your skills and hard work to move you forward. Responsibilities: As an Associate, you will participate in the evaluation of the credit quality of governmental enterprises—specifically transportation—as it relates to their ability to repay debt obligations. You will be responsible for aggregating data and information to present to rating committees. You will interact with clients, make presentations, and prepare reports for internal and external distribution. This position will also include managing and processing large data sets. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:• MBA, MPA, MPP or similar advanced degree preferred• BS, BA in finance, accounting, economics, government/public policy, or similar field required• Minimum 2+ years of relevant work experience required• A demonstrated interest in municipal enterprises and how they work • Strong work ethic and ability to work well both independently and as part a team • Strong ability to work with financial models and data, including cash flow and credit models • Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with clients • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to learn in both formal training and on-the-job settings • Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven environment • Ability to be highly organized, detail-oriented, and juggle multiple priorities at once About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. JobTitle: Assistant Auto Center Manager - Farmington, NM – Sears Holdings Corporation – 856832BR
JobText: Job Cart (0) Assistant Auto Center Manager – Farmington, NM Job ID: 856832BR Brand: Sears Employment Status: Regular, Full-time Automotive 4601 E MAIN ST,FARMINGTON, NM 87401, US June 17, 2017 Apply Keep Me In Mind Add to Cart In partnership with the Auto Center Manager, this position is responsible for assisting with the management of the Auto Center and Associates in centers with a volume under $1.1 million. Personally provides professional, timely and courteous service by listening carefully to customers, presenting Sears Automotive products clearly, and teaming with technicians. The Assistant Manager ensures consistent, timely, and accurate service delivery to customers by building, supervising, and training a high performance selling and service team. The Assistant Manager works closely with the Auto Center Manager as well as the District Service Manager to ensure achievement of business goals and great customer service on a daily basis. This includes, but is not limited to, management of Associates analyses and driving of sales volume, customer service, profitability and performance identification and solution of business problems creation and implementation of competitive strategies managing productivity standards and other responsibilities as assigned by the Auto Center Manager or the District Service Manager. The Assistant Auto Center Manager assists in the daily operation of the Auto Center in partnership with the Auto Center Manager. The Assistant Manager is expected to spend most of his/her time on management duties on a daily and weekly basis. In the absence of the Auto Center Manager, the Assistant Manager assumes all management duties and responsibilities for the Auto Center. The Assistant Manager occasionally spends some of his/her time directly selling to customers and addressing their needs. Job Duties/Responsibilities: * Assists in planning and strategy to lead Auto Center to ensure achievement of business goals in sales and service.* Teaches, Manages and provides positive and constructive feedback.* Plans, directs and supervises the work and productivity levels of Associates to ensure standards are met or exceeded.* Recognizes, encourages and acknowledges excellent customer service.* Performs as the Customer Experience Manager on duty.* Ensures delivery of speed and expertise to the customer through assistance in management of day to day business processes and programs.* Responsible for determining appropriate outcomes to customer issues and concerns by making sound business decisions.* Achieves personal sales and service goals and helps team in achieving the same.* Delivers speed and expertise to the customer through daily execution of business processes and programs.* Miscellaneous duties as assigned. Job Requirements: * Must have a valid Driver’s License* Supervisory Experience Preferred Skills:* ASE Certified* Bachelor’s Degree Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Vet. JobText: Job Cart (0) Cashiers, temporary position Job ID: 847326BR Brand: Sears Employment Status: Seasonal Cashier 290 PROVIDENCE HWY,FLS- SEARS DEDHAM MALL MA,DEDHAM, MA 02026, US June 17, 2017 Apply Keep Me In Mind Add to Cart Responsible for providing excellent customer service, efficiently and accurately completing sales and service transactions at the cash wraps, as well as handle customer issues that may arise on the sales floor. * Takes ownership for enhancing the customer experience * Partners with selling and sales support associates to provide superior customer service (i.e., assist customers, answer phones) * Leverages technology in order to facilitate the customer experience * Completes customer transactions accurately and efficiently at point-of-sale * Executes consistent operational and selling processes (i.e., credit application process, ratchet repair program) * Optimizes credit, gift card, Shop Your Way Rewards and multi-channel opportunities (and, where applicable, Protection Agreements, Merchandise Replacement Agreements, and other miscellaneous income opportunities) * Educates customers on our Satisfaction Guaranteed return policy; * Assists in resolving customer issues * Assists with merchandise support tasks (i.e., fitting room maintenance, straightening merchandise) during non-peak hours * Adheres to merchandise protection standards * Uses basic internet navigation to access and print information/reports * Performs other duties as assigned * Basic reading, arithmetic, writing and oral communication skills * Basic internet navigation Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Vet.
